commit_message:
DB: Support filter_by status in get_bay_list

bay list filter doesn't support filter_by status currently
this is useful if we want to pull bay status in [status1, statu2].

This patch add status(which is a list) filter when query from db.

Closes-Bug: #1467853
Change-Id: Id6d0618b8030883b1a534d2f27dda4c6464eb0a1

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-19 21:06:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-identity/commit/3c5a84b1bb9146f46070130d1155fe83361ef5db', 'message': 'Allow keystone under apache

Keystone is recommended to run under apache and the service side
is already deprecated and will be removed in the M release.
This patch adds a new recipe, server-apache, to allow keystone
under apache.

I intentionally just copied the existing server recipe and spec to
create the new ones and I figure those will just be removed in
the M release anyway, no need for "common" type code here.

The majority of the recipe code is exactly the same, just the
last lines, "Start of Apache..." have been added.

This should also work with the existing dashboard cookbook with the
one exception that the apache 3.1 cookbook is needed.  There's already
a patch out for that.

I don't plan on changing the default kilo role to use this, that will
be done once we branch for liberty.

Change-Id: I1641e1e5c6bf56d0765ef6e54ae32848431f6d6e

Change-Id: I1641e1e5c6bf56d0765ef6e54ae32848431f6d6e
Implements: blueprint keystone-apache
'}]
commit_message:
Allow keystone under apache

Keystone is recommended to run under apache and the service side
is already deprecated and will be removed in the M release.
This patch adds a new recipe, server-apache, to allow keystone
under apache.

I intentionally just copied the existing server recipe and spec to
create the new ones and I figure those will just be removed in
the M release anyway, no need for "common" type code here.

The majority of the recipe code is exactly the same, just the
last lines, "Start of Apache..." have been added.

This should also work with the existing dashboard cookbook with the
one exception that the apache 3.1 cookbook is needed.  There's already
a patch out for that.

I don't plan on changing the default kilo role to use this, that will
be done once we branch for liberty.

Change-Id: I1641e1e5c6bf56d0765ef6e54ae32848431f6d6e
Implements: blueprint keystone-apache

commit_message:
Unknown type 'any' in pythonk8sclient removed.

Currently the generated code has type 'any' in many models which leads to
error 'ImportError'. So this patch removes all 'any' type to relevant types
of the attributes.

Change-Id: I333b1edd2c84875c48db1e5ff2655360ffcc9718
Closes-bug: #1467345

commit_message:
Show not-in-global errors again.

This regressed when I half-split it into actions and IO (exception
raising). Moving it entirely into actions lets us see all the errors
very easily.

Change-Id: I12e6d910bf983841b4ad81aa41a95bf341456fe4

subject: Add upper-constraints.txt.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-08 10:12:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/c5a286db051b77fde25384c694d8f2f350022101', 'message': "Add upper-constraints.txt.

This is a first approximation to the transitive union of requirements,
built by generate-constraints with python 2.7 and 3.4. It will be
updated by a periodic job (which we'll add shortly) proposing future
merges to this repository. Its not yet cross-checked for compatibility
with proposed global-requirements.txt changes, that will come later.

Having the file present now allows us to start working on the
consuming side in parallel and has no downsides, since no projects
jobs will be voting based on this until all the pieces are in place
and battle tested.

Change-Id: Ifc04c81fd8d52051a0f09a6fd61b06da035c513f

merges to this repository. Its not yet cross-checked for compatibility
with proposed global-requirements.txt changes, that will come later.

Having the file present now allows us to start working on the
consuming side in parallel and has no downsides, since no projects
jobs will be voting based on this until all the pieces are in place
and battle tested.

Change-Id: Ifc04c81fd8d52051a0f09a6fd61b06da035c513f
"}]
commit_message:
Add upper-constraints.txt.

This is a first approximation to the transitive union of requirements,
built by generate-constraints with python 2.7 and 3.4. It will be
updated by a periodic job (which we'll add shortly) proposing future
merges to this repository. Its not yet cross-checked for compatibility
with proposed global-requirements.txt changes, that will come later.

Having the file present now allows us to start working on the
consuming side in parallel and has no downsides, since no projects
jobs will be voting based on this until all the pieces are in place
and battle tested.

Change-Id: Ifc04c81fd8d52051a0f09a6fd61b06da035c513f

commit_message:
Remove icehouse compat jobs from tempest

This commit removes the icehouse compat jobs from the tempest queues.
The icehouse branch will be eol'd at the end of this week, the final
release has already been pushed. However, a recent oslo release has
broken all of the icehouse jobs. Since the release is no longer
supported let's just remove the jobs to unblock tempest.

Change-Id: Ie0cec835c250cd9180e3083ae2d3c28dff78e3fc

commit_message:
Teach the constraints generator about excludes.

Some things like flake8 can't be constrained, so we need an opt-out
clause.

Change-Id: I11eb0d762869ad8920795fb710f1b2eeb9354f12

commit_message:
Object: pass filter to bay list

get_bay_list in db api layer has support adding filters before query bay,
but bay object doesn't pass filter yet.

This patch enables filter by adding parameter filter in bay's list method.

Closes-Bug: #1467735
Change-Id: I7969727544dff2c4bf5e556ccac1c5574a8f6620
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/68/194568/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_list_with_filters(self): with mock.patch.object(self.dbapi, 'get_bay_list', autospec=True) as mock_get_list: mock_get_list.return_value = [self.fake_bay] filters = {'name': 'bay1'} bays = objects.Bay.list(self.context, filters=filters) mock_get_list.assert_called_once_with(self.context, sort_key=None, sort_dir=None, filters=filters, limit=None, marker=None) self.assertEqual(mock_get_list.call_count, 1) self.assertThat(bays, HasLength(1)) self.assertIsInstance(bays[0], objects.Bay) self.assertEqual(self.context, bays[0]._context)

commit_message:
Wait until the image is registered in Sahara image test

The tests consistently fails, probably because the availability
of the image in the table is checked too soon. Add a bit of delay
with a new wait method.

Change-Id: I9e39c35fb67455b4e4f3c2b12265b8540420ad01
Closes-Bug: #1466744

commit_message:
Bump minimum requirement for os-client-config

There is a new API in os-client-config 1.4.0 that is needed to add
more complete os-client-config support to openstacksdk.

commit_message:
Fix typo in container controller

image_id is not used for baymodel, just used for container.
This commit fixes it.

Change-Id: Id8a9fa95698d6b73d02b2687803f9614e612842d
Closes-Bug: #1465558

commit_message:
Allow drivers to ask for additional share_servers

Add new method choose_share_server_compatible_for_share()
to Share Driver interface. This method is executed in
Share Manager on share creation step to filter existing
share servers. Driver should choose one share server from
the list or return None. If this method returns None, then
Share Manager starts the creation of new share server.

Also, this commit adds a possibility to create share
from a snapshot on share server which differs from original
share server where the snapshot is placed.

Implements bp allow-additional-share-servers

Change-Id: Ia85fcf69b953c199808d7e7d3cb0652c2425fd9d

commit_message:
Angular translation makemessages for singular An approach to i18n for Angular HTML templates. This patch allow only singular translation. Plural and context will be address in subsequent patches. Steps to verify that it works: 1. Create a new html file in horizon/static or openstack_dashboard/static 2. Add something like
hello world!
to the html 3. Run ./run_test.sh --makemessages 4. Inspect your djangojs.po file, it should be there. 5. Run ./run_test.sh --pseudo de 6. Run ./run_test.sh --compilemessages 7. Go to http://localhost:9000/settings 8. Change Language to Deutsch 9. Go to http://localhost:9000/i18n/js/horizon+openstack_dashboard 10. Your translated text should be there as well. Change-Id: I4f417e16ccd0b11b3a1923578e4c7156da2ce10f Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-translate-makemessages

added_lines: import fnmatch import os import re from optparse import make_option from django.core.management.commands import makemessages class Command(makemessages.Command): temp_name = 'angularjsi18n.js' regex = r'(<[\w-]+ translate>)([\w\d\s\.\?\!]+)(</[\w-]+>)' option_list = makemessages.Command.option_list + ( make_option('--ng-translate', default=None, action='append', dest='ngtranslate', help='Preprocess static htmls and extract translatable texts.' ), make_option('--static-path', default='./static', action='append', dest='static_path', help='Path to the static folder.' ), ) def search_and_extract(self): """Search for all files in the static path matching the given extension. Creates a temp file to store all of the matching strings. Static path and extensions are configurable via otions. """ if not self.ngtranslate: return try: self.temp_path = os.path.join(self.static_path, self.temp_name) self.temp_file = open(self.temp_path, 'w') for root, dirs, files in os.walk(self.static_path): for extension in self.ngtranslate: for filename in fnmatch.filter(files, '*.' + extension): filepath = os.path.join(root, filename) self.extract(filepath) except IOError: self.stdout.write("IOError: error opening %s" % self.temp_name) finally: self.temp_file.close() def extract(self, filepath): """Given a path, attempt to open the file and extract all strings matching the regex. Matched strings are wrapped in a gettext or equivalent and written to a temporary file. """ try: with open(filepath, 'r') as file: matches = re.findall(self.regex, file.read()) for match in matches: output = "gettext('%s')" % match[1] self.temp_file.write(output) except IOError: self.stdout.write("IOError: error reading %s" % filepath) def remove_tempfile(self): """After temp file has been processed, we remove it. """ if self.ngtranslate: os.unlink(self.temp_path) def handle(self, *args, **options): self.ngtranslate = options.get('ngtranslate') self.static_path = options.get('static_path') self.search_and_extract() super(makemessages.Command, self).handle(*args, **options) self.remove_tempfile()

subject: Mark as Python2.7 only the dependencies that are.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-08 10:12:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/445f2a91d66af7829bea349c86194abf8d900afc', 'message': "Mark as Python2.7 only the dependencies that are.

We shouldn't try to install on 3.x dependencies that are only
supported on < 3.0. I've used =='2.7' rather than <'3.0' because
setuptools support for < is still spotty and we're tracking that down
and we don't support 2.6 anymore AIUI. I can make this an OR clause
with both 2.6 and 2.7 if we still care about 2.6.

Change-Id: I03667e3e76fd8d84b75dcb5b61742a3f13040662

commit_message:
Mark as Python2.7 only the dependencies that are.

We shouldn't try to install on 3.x dependencies that are only
supported on < 3.0. I've used =='2.7' rather than <'3.0' because
setuptools support for < is still spotty and we're tracking that down
and we don't support 2.6 anymore AIUI. I can make this an OR clause
with both 2.6 and 2.7 if we still care about 2.6.

Change-Id: I03667e3e76fd8d84b75dcb5b61742a3f13040662
Depends-On: I2c4cb4305fec81a5fd237edabee78874ccd0da22

Adding support for licenses in trove.

Change-Id: Ib84bb1fa02e008fb64a8d76a2a309a1bffb81e28
Blueprint: trove-license-installation
'}]
commit_message:
Adding licensing support for clusters and instances

Adding support for licenses in trove.

Change-Id: Ib84bb1fa02e008fb64a8d76a2a309a1bffb81e28
Blueprint: trove-license-installation
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-specs refs/changes/56/194856/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: ======================== Integration of licensing support ======================== Introduction We would like to introduce licensing support in trove by creating a separate top level resource for licenses. This would allow users to associate licenses with a particular datastore version. The license can be configured upon installation of the datastore or added later. This would allow for a better tracking of clusters or instances associated to a specific license. A license can be added at any time. Additionally, a license can be modified/deleted if no running instance is associated with it at the time. The details for implementation of this feature are detailed in this specification. Launchpad Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/trove-license-installation ==================================================================================== Description Currently, there is no way of associating a license with a datastore version. To implement this, it is imperative that a separate schema of licensing information be created. A particular license may have many datastore versions it belongs to, so another table must be added which stores the one-to-many relationship between license IDs and datastore version(s) it is associated with. Upon cluster/instance creation, the license ID must be specified in order to associate it to a single instance or a cluster. By default, if no license ID is specified then there is no license associated to the instance/cluster. When adding a new license the datastore type and datastore version must be specified. When deleting/updating a license, there must be no running instances using that associated license. ==================================================================================== Proposal To implement the changes needed to incorporate licenses in trove, a separate database table for licenses would be required. This database table will have license ID as the primary key which will be used to identify a particular license. Each license object will also have a multiple datastore versions to which it is associated, some metadata, the actual license key, and a license name for users understanding. Tenant ID will control who has access to the license, if tenant ID is NULL then license will be public and can be used by any tenant. When user adds the license, their tenant ID will be associated with the license. When an admin uses trove-manage to add a license, they can specify any tenant ID to be associated with the license or can specify NULL to make it public. Also, the trove-cli for creating a cluster and updating a cluster will have to be modified. ==================================================================================== Database The implementation would require a new licenses database table. The attribute licenseID is the primary key for each license in the licenses table. Also, in many cases a license might have multiple datastore versions it is associated with. Therefore, another table for datastore versions and license IDs should be created. License ID needs to be added as a referential key to tables which will be associated to licenses. ==================================================================================== Public API Request:: ---------- POST /v1.0/{tenant_id}/licenses { "license": { ""key": "hf72h8h281hn287afavs63172tdgfd273b", "name": "vertical license", "datastore": { "name" : "vertica", "versions" : [ 1.6, 1.7, 1.8 ] }, "metadata": { "license_version": 2, "details" : "Date of issue 09/14/2015", "nodes": 10 } } } ---------- Response:: ---------- { "license": { "id" : UUID "created" : "2015-01-29T20:18:23" "name": "vertical license", } } ---------- Request:: ---------- PUT /v1.0/{tenant_id}/licenses/{licenseID} { "license": { "key": "hf72h8h281hn287afavs63172tdgfd273b", "name": "vertica license", "datastore": { "name" : "vertica", "versions" : [ 1.6, 1.7, 1.8, 1.9 ] }, "metadata": { "license_version": 3, "details" : "Date of issue 09/14/2015", "nodes": 11 } } } ---------- Response:: ---------- { "license": { "id" : 1 "updated" : "2015-01-29T20:18:23" } } ---------- Request:: ---------- GET /v1.0/{tenant_id}/licenses/{licenseID} { } ---------- Response:: ---------- { "license": { "id" : 1 "key": "hf72h8h281hn287afavs63172tdgfd273b", "name": "vertica license", "metadata": { "license_version": 2, "details" : "Date of issue 09/14/2015", "nodes": 10 } } } ---------- Request:: ---------- DELETE /v1.0/{tenant_id}/licenses/{licenseID} No message body { } ---------- This operation has no response body { } =============================== CLI (python-troveclient) The following Trove CLI commands (upon completion) will be fully functional - license-create - license-delete - license-list - license-show - license-update ================================ Internal API Changes also need to be made to the internal API to include the license ID as a part of the message body that is sent to the task manager. ================================ Implementation Assignee(s) ------------ Primary assignee: sharika.pongubala@hp.com ------------ Work Items ------------ - Make changes to the schema - Add changes to the public API - Add changes to the trove client API  create/delete/list/show/update license will have to be added  create/show cluster needs to be updated to add license ID for clusters  create/show needs to be updated to add license ID for instances - Add changes to the Internal API - Events generated should have license information ================================ Testing Additional tests will be added ================================ Documentation -Cluster/instance creation methodology -Trove Capabilities for Clusters. ================================

commit_message:
Only install python-libguestfs bindings when needed

Currently those bindings are missing from SLES12, and since
they're not actually used unless file injection is enabled
(which is not by default), only conditionally depend on it.

Change-Id: I79a8d8ac7ad2fbd7d2fce696821d130218e43e03
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/80/187980/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ENABLE_FILE_INJECTION=$(trueorfalse False ENABLE_FILE_INJECTION) if [[ "$ENABLE_FILE_INJECTION" = "True" ]] ; then if is_ubuntu; then install_package python-guestfs elif is_fedora || is_suse; then install_package python-libguestfs fi fi

commit_message:
Fix Cinder Objects unit tests

Due to the import order all tests passed on CI. But you can not
run cinder.unit.objects.test_backup only. This patch fixes it
adding base class and invokes objects.register_all().

Change-Id: If6168bce88489840b5d25b97be1f285737d943df

added_lines: t1 = timeutils.now() try: return RootwrapDaemonHelper(CONF.rootwrap_config).execute( *cmd, **kwargs) finally: LOG.debug( ">>> RootwrapDaemonHelper:execute = %(wait_secs)0.3fs " ": %(cmd)s", {'wait_secs': (timeutils.now() - t1), 'cmd': cmd}) else: try: return RootwrapProcessHelper().execute(*cmd, **kwargs) finally: LOG.debug( ">>> RootwrapProcessHelper:execute = %(wait_secs)0.3fs " ": %(cmd)s", {'wait_secs': (timeutils.now() - t1), 'cmd': cmd}) try: return processutils.execute(*cmd, **kwargs) finally: LOG.debug( ">>> processutils.execute = %(wait_secs)0.3fs " ": %(cmd)s", {'wait_secs': (timeutils.now() - t1), 'cmd': cmd}) t1 = timeutils.now() try: return RootwrapDaemonHelper(CONF.rootwrap_config).trycmd( *args, **kwargs) finally: LOG.debug( ">>> RootwrapDaemonHelper:trycmd = %(wait_secs)0.3fs " ": %(cmd)s", {'wait_secs': (timeutils.now() - t1), 'cmd': args}) else: try: return RootwrapProcessHelper().trycmd(*args, **kwargs) finally: LOG.debug( ">>> RootwrapProcessHelper:trycmd = %(wait_secs)0.3fs " ": %(cmd)s", {'wait_secs': (timeutils.now() - t1), 'cmd': args}) try: return processutils.trycmd(*args, **kwargs) finally: LOG.debug( ">>> processutils.trycmd = %(wait_secs)0.3fs " ": %(cmd)s", {'wait_secs': (timeutils.now() - t1), 'cmd': args})
deleted_lines: return RootwrapDaemonHelper(CONF.rootwrap_config).execute( *cmd, **kwargs) else: return RootwrapProcessHelper().execute(*cmd, **kwargs) return processutils.execute(*cmd, **kwargs) return RootwrapDaemonHelper(CONF.rootwrap_config).trycmd( *args, **kwargs) else: return RootwrapProcessHelper().trycmd(*args, **kwargs) return processutils.trycmd(*args, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Rebase: move nova VNC conf opts to 'vnc' group

The following Nova change set moved VNC-related config options to a
'vnc' group.

commit 380c4d750f8c53c8ab862082984079a633043b9c
Author: Diana Clarke <diana.joan.clarke@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Jun 21 23:13:26 2015 -0400

    Register the vnc config options under group 'vnc'

    Also renamed 'vnc_enabled' to 'enabled', and 'vnc_keymap' to
'keymap' now
    that those options are prefixed by the 'vnc' group.

    Change-Id: I2ff668d4ebd8e6ebf9bf4e8ca5b077958f051144
    Closes-Bug: #1447528

Rebase to accomodate the change.

Change-Id: I455275feb7b71e156b8b68f906efb1ffa7cbb548
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/45/194845/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CONF.import_opt('vncserver_proxyclient_address', 'nova.vnc', group='vnc') CONF.import_opt('vncserver_listen', 'nova.vnc', group='vnc')

commit_message:
drop use of oslo.db private attribute

new oslo.db is deprecating existing EngineFacade. a private attr
was removed which our code incorrectly uses. it is not necessary
to use it anyways.

initially introduced here: I57b6d89f30c065643dbfab958e032f2adac59cd6
Closes-Bug: #1468082

Change-Id: I5bc9c3d144294749bee28f5ea78e93861c24bc29
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/94/194794/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix for multiple entries in ucast_mac_remote

checking mac and logical switch while creating l2-gateway-connection,
if there is entry in ucast_mac_remote for second l2-gateway-connection for
same logical switch.
taken care of deleting ucast_mac_remote and vlan_bindings
while deleting l2-gateway-connection.

Closes-Bug:1447910

Co-Authored-By: Phani Pawan <ppawan@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: MANJUNATH PATIL <mpatil@hp.com>

Change-Id: Id9205c902210d94d7168eb95fbd6c3520fbb6239

commit_message:
Fix for internal server error

internal server error occurs if empty l2gateway is passed in
_check_port_fault_status_and_switch_fault_status.so checking the the same.

Closes-Bug: 1454670

Change-Id: I5faba8d5e097b5ca8aeec44b7fde0a61d98486e4

commit_message:
Add base image for oraclelinux

This patch provides the basis for an alternate set of images to be
available in Kolla, based on oraclelinux.

It is difficult ahead of time to know all base dependencies and exactly
which repos they'll come from, so at this time I have just added the bare
minimum.

In the next commit keystone will require some essentials that will
likely make sense to add here.

NOTE: To build this image you must set the following .buildconf in the
root of the kolla repo:

cat >> .buildconf << EOF
PREFIX=ol-binary-
EOF

Partially implements: blueprint add-optional-oraclelinux-images

Change-Id: I1ccce8eebe8fa0d4342af2aa482c083d074bda66
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/13/191013/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: FROM oraclelinux:7.1 MAINTAINER Kolla Project (https://launchpad.net/kolla) # Update packages RUN yum update -y && yum clean all # Install python-pip RUN curl https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py -o get-pip.py \ && python get-pip.py \ && rm -f get-pip.py # Install base packages RUN yum install -y \ git # Install base packages provided via pypi RUN pip install \ crudini RUN mkdir -p /opt/kolla COPY service_hosts.sh kolla-common.sh /opt/kolla/

commit_message:
Possible parallel version.

Use with caution: its possible db locks will defeat the parallelism
this attempts and make everything slower, not faster. If so, rewriting
it to use one thread per context instead of just plain parallelism
should work.

Change-Id: I5d810941feb0c49fb6323270b855c06da07f3bc7

added_lines: import concurrent.futuresimport threading class FailedBug(Exception):pass bts = list(proj.searchTasks(status=statuses, milestone=milestone)) def update_bug(bt): print "%s - copytasked" % bug.id print "%s - task already exists, skipping" % bug.id start = time.time() end = time.time() print "lpsave %s %s %0.3fs" % (bug.id, start, end-start) print "%s - released" % bug.id except ServerError as e: end = time.time() print "timeout lpsave %s %s %0.3fs" % (bug.id, start, end-start) raise FailedBug(bug.id) print "%s (not in FixReleased status!)" % bug.id with concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=40) as executor: # Start the load operations and mark each future with its URL future_to_bt = { executor.submit(update_bug, bt): bt for bt in bts} for future in concurrent.futures.as_completed(future_to_bt): bt = future_to_by[future] try: data = future.result() except FailedBug as exc: failed.add(exc.args[0]) except Exception as exc: print "unexpected exception" % exc

commit_message:
SUSE: Clean up libxslt/libxml2 related dependencies

libxml2-devel is a dependency of libxslt-devel, so we don't need
to explicitly include it. Also, since it is only really needed
by python-lxml, consolidate it into devlibs and remove the copies.
Also remove a non-existing package reference along the way

Change-Id: If9afaaa93f2c485baa1efff74d7ae58c59713de6

commit_message:
Make resize api of compute manager to send flavor object

This code change implements the conversion of flavor to use object. Rpcapi of
compute manager sends objects for new version and sents primitivized data for
older versions.

Related to blueprint liberty-objects

Change-Id: I11a28cd3b2eb98b42d78f9327ed6b38dc2bc8f30

commit_message:
Add yaql

yaql is actively used by two openstack projects - Murano and Mistral.
Heat community also considered using yaql for imperative things in
Heat templates.

Information about project:
* Hosted on stackforge
* Uses standard tools such as tox, pbr, testrepository
* Python3 compatible
* It is packaged in Debian: https://tracker.debian.org/pkg/python-yaql

Adding yaql to global-requirements will help Murano and Mistral to
adopt Infra automation for automated update of requirements (Proposal Bot).
It also might help adoption of yaql in other projects.

Change-Id: I1881bccc988033b4ee8b587b233010c2d224a93e

commit_message:
mariadb-app missing symlink

The mariadb-app container wouldn't build because it was missing
a symbolic link to mysql-entrypoint.sh.  This was causing the
gate to fail entirely.

Change-Id: I5fc4db2a8c92403ee9d3f41dbdd2a156227a2aa3
Closes-bug: #1467280

commit_message:
Add convenience tox environments

Add a venv tox environment like we use in other projects to build a
virtualenv and run commands.

Add an 'update' environment to run the command for updating the
requirements in another project.

Add a 'generate' environment to run the command for generating
constraints.

Change-Id: Ib99fb4da6f62afd31339fa698c8f0e50ce817128

commit_message:
Ansible playbooks and roles to deploy OpenStack

Request to add the os-ansible-deployment project to OpenStack namespace.
os-ansible-deployment (OSAD) is a project dedicated to deploying OpenStack
clouds using Ansible and upstream OpenStack source code without the addition
of vendor driven packaging.

This project is already using all of the OpenStack infrastructure and services
and is gated through gerrit with testing being done on the whole stack using
tempest on our three supported branches.

We are committed to furthering our mission of a great
developer/deployer/operator experience and intend to build out the system to
support all of the OpenStack named services.

We use the OpenStack dev/operators mailing list (albeit infrequently) and hold
meetings twice weekly[1] (one in our channel and the other in an official
OpenStack meeting channel which is logged[2]).

The IRC channel #openstack-ansible is logged[3], and active with community
members, core developers and like minted people all helping and disusing issues
within the project as well as questions that come us from using Ansible to
operate and manage clouds.

The scope of os-ansible-deployment is to provide tooling for deploying OpenStack
using ansible which will include contributing to the efforts of upstream
Ansible. We are already working with the community to ensure that our efforts
are not duplicated or being made in direct contrast to what upstream Ansible is
already providing. While we do have some overlap within our currently carried
modules, the OpenStack client modules we have in tree, we are committed to moving
that functionality and code into upstream just as we've done with our other
plugins/modules[4][5].

With this project's move to "big tent" we'd only be looking to bring with us the
Master and Kilo branches as they've been designed to be community code with
all of the original Rackspace-isms removed. This would mean that the Juno and
Icehouse branches would be left behind in StackForge as they'd not be part of
the mainline project but we, the community of developers working on OSAD, will
be supporting those code bases until they're EOL'd by the upstream OpenStack
projects.

This commit is a formal request to add os-ansible-deployment into the
OpenStack namespace as an official project.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Meetings/openstack-ansible
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/openstack_ansible_meeting/
[3] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ansible/
[4] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/9927
[5] https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-extras/pull/123

Change-Id: Id3f6175fcdd4a21019eabca56cd337145ff9c2b0

commit_message:
Fix OSProfiler exception when is enabled

When OSProfiler is enabled in glance-api.conf or glance-registry.conf,
the services are failing to start. They raise an AtttributeError
exception when not finding messaging module from notifier

When oslo removed namespaced packages in kilo, the code was changed
in glance.notifier from doing

	from oslo import messaging

To doing

        import oslo_messaging

And all references were changed from messaging to oslo_messaging. When
osprofiler integration was added, the author choose to use the notifier
module's reference to oslo.messaging instead of importing it directly.
When the rename occurred, this was not caught. So, oslo_messaging is
directly imported in glance.cmd.{api,registry,search} and use it as
it was intended

Closes-Bug: #1467982

Change-Id: I87c0d4f0885f5714e966218eabf06134772babfa
Signed-off-by: Munoz, Obed N <obed.n.munoz@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/27/194727/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Cap oslo.il8n to allow for transition away from oslo namespace

This commit adds a version cap to prevent pulling in oslo.il8n v2.0.0.
This latest release removed the namespace package which breaks
glance_store and a bunch of the clients usage of oslo.il8n. We need to
stop using this release (and all future versions of oslo.il8n) until
all the packages we depend on using the oslo namespace for the il8n
module are fixed.

Change-Id: I775fe85bb320a819e32e33b7097332dd75b4aa98

commit_message:
Use sudo to move hook script logs

Hook script retention was failing on neutron-dsvm-functional jobs
due to permission failure.  This change uses sudo ensure that
hook script logs are always retained, which seems to be the common
pattern for test artifact retention.

Change-Id: Ic855b79a657245896aa74fc274d3b8e72ab3a507

subject: Disable allowed_address_pair ip 0.0.0.0/0 ::/0 for ipset
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-23 15:01:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/extensions/allowedaddresspairs.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_extension_allowedaddresspairs.py', 'tools/fix_zero_length_ip_prefix.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d9c78880d2b7e5b0544e821c45e6ad3700a06b9a', 'message': "Disable allowed_address_pair ip 0.0.0.0/0 ::/0 for ipset

Previously, the ipset_manager would pass in 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 if
these addresses were inputted as allowed address pairs. This causes
ipset to raise an error as it does not work with zero prefix sizes.
To solve this problem we use two ipset rules to represent this.

This was correctly fixed in a backport to kilo though we did not have the
cycles to backport this exact fix to juno as in juno additional work needs to
be done because the iptable and ipset code are interleaved together. This
patch fixes this issue by disabling one from creating an address pair of
zero lenght. This patch also provides a small tool which one should run:
tools/fix_zero_length_ip_prefix.py which changes all zero length address_pair
rules into two address pair rules of:

Ipv4: 0.0.0.0/1 and 128.0.0.1/1
IPv6: ::/1' and '8000::/1

to avoid the problem.
After this patch is merged into juno it will be easier for us to apply
a better change to allow /0 addresses again in juno.

Change-Id: I8c6a08e0cf3b5b5386fe03af9f2174c666b8ac75
Closes-bug: 1461054
Co-Authored-by: Darragh O'Reilly <darragh.oreilly@hp.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Disable allowed_address_pair ip 0.0.0.0/0 ::/0 for ipset

Previously, the ipset_manager would pass in 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 if
these addresses were inputted as allowed address pairs. This causes
ipset to raise an error as it does not work with zero prefix sizes.
To solve this problem we use two ipset rules to represent this.

This was correctly fixed in a backport to kilo though we did not have the
cycles to backport this exact fix to juno as in juno additional work needs to
be done because the iptable and ipset code are interleaved together. This
patch fixes this issue by disabling one from creating an address pair of
zero lenght. This patch also provides a small tool which one should run:
tools/fix_zero_length_ip_prefix.py which changes all zero length address_pair
rules into two address pair rules of:

Ipv4: 0.0.0.0/1 and 128.0.0.1/1
IPv6: ::/1' and '8000::/1

to avoid the problem.
After this patch is merged into juno it will be easier for us to apply
a better change to allow /0 addresses again in juno.

Change-Id: I8c6a08e0cf3b5b5386fe03af9f2174c666b8ac75
Closes-bug: 1461054
Co-Authored-by: Darragh O'Reilly <darragh.oreilly@hp.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/96/194696/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: """ This script is needed to convert addresses that are zero prefix to be two address of one prefix to avoid a bug that exists in juno where the ipset manager isn't able to handle zero prefix lenght addresses. """ import os import sys import netaddr from neutronclient.v2_0 import client def main(): try: username = os.environ['OS_USERNAME'] tenant_name = os.environ['OS_TENANT_NAME'] password = os.environ['OS_PASSWORD'] auth_url = os.environ['OS_AUTH_URL'] except KeyError: print("You need to source your openstack creds file first!") sys.exit(1) neutron = client.Client(username=username, tenant_name=tenant_name, password=password, auth_url=auth_url) ports = neutron.list_ports() for port in ports['ports']: new_address_pairs = [] needs_update = False allowed_address_pairs = port.get('allowed_address_pairs') if allowed_address_pairs: for address_pair in allowed_address_pairs: ip = address_pair['ip_address'] mac = address_pair['mac_address'] if(netaddr.IPNetwork(ip).prefixlen == 0): needs_update = True if(netaddr.IPNetwork(ip).version == 4): new_address_pairs.append({'ip_address': '0.0.0.0/1', 'mac_address': mac}) new_address_pairs.append({'ip_address': '128.0.0.0/1', 'mac_address': mac}) elif(netaddr.IPNetwork(ip).version == 6): new_address_pairs.append({'ip_address': '::/1', 'mac_address': mac}) new_address_pairs.append({'ip_address': '8000::/1', 'mac_address': mac}) else: new_address_pairs.append(address_pair) if needs_update: print ("Updating port %s with new address_pairs %s" % (port['id'], new_address_pairs)) neutron.update_port( port['id'], {'port': {'allowed_address_pairs': new_address_pairs}}) main()

deleted_lines: .. _streamlined-patching-ref: Mirantis OpenStack streamlined patching ======================================= The streamlined patching feature introduced in Mirantis OpenStack 6.1 is the process of delivering product updates to users. .. note:: The streamlined patching feature is introduced in Mirantis OpenStack 6.1 and will not work in older releases. Streamlined patching consists of the following four parts: * Packaging of Fuel and Mirantis OpenStack components * Patching Continuous Integration (CI) * Errata portal * User notification system Packaging of Fuel and Mirantis OpenStack components --------------------------------------------------- All components are built on per case basis and are installed from RPM and DEB packages. Packages are versioned according to the following scheme: `[package-name]-[version]-[number of commits]`. Patching CI ----------- Patching CI runs on internal Mirantis servers and contains jobs that perform the following tasks: * Tests that both CentOS and Ubuntu packages are built correctly for a given patch. * Tests that each patch references a task in the Mirantis tracking system, and that each task references an errata item (explained below). * Tests that each patch is applied successfully to a clean environment deployed from the release ISO. * Tests that each patch deploys successfully. Errata portal ------------- `The errata portal <http://errata.mirantis.com/>`_ can be accessed by any user of the product. Every patch listed at the errata portal contains the following items: * Issue statement and description of the fix * Link to CVE (if applicable) * List of affected packages (before the fix) * List of updated packages (containing the fix) * Patching scenario * Verification scenario User notification system ------------------------ All users registered at the `official Mirantis website <https://www.mirantis.com/>`_ receive notifications of when there are new patches available in an aggregate form. Streamlined patching how-to --------------------------- For your user experience and how-to see :ref:`Applying streamlined patching<streamlined-patching-ops>`.

deleted_lines: .. index:: Identify Files .. _IdFile: Identify files to be patched ---------------------------- Identifying files or components to be patched usually involves investigating change logs for new OpenStack releases or git commit messages. You can find change logs using `OpenStack wiki search <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Special:Search/ReleaseNotes>`_. Git commit messages are available from github.com or, in a more accesible form, on git.openstack.org. You will need to find the exact commit providing the fix for your problem. For example, looking at the Release Notes for the 2013.1.4 OpenStack Grizzly bugfix update, you can drill into the `List of OpenStack Compute (Nova) bugs fixed in the 2013.1.4 release <https://launchpad.net/nova/grizzly/2013.1.4>`_ and find that an `Incorrect host stats reported by VMware VCDriver <https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1190515>`_ issue has been resolved.

commit_message:
Mask database.event_connection details in logs

In notification and collector logs, database connection
details are masked, but other connection strings are not.

This fix masks the event_connection, metering_connection
and alarm_connection strings.

Change-Id: Ib1fdc02e0c0d9cca1201f8304db4584d14498de1
Closes-Bug: #1456263
(cherry picked from commit d05a8f0a37689c6c44a4d91725a3b14135c07eb4)

commit_message:
Register the vnc config options under group 'vnc'

Also renamed 'vnc_enabled' to 'enabled', and 'vnc_keymap' to 'keymap' now
that those options are prefixed by the 'vnc' group.

Change-Id: I2ff668d4ebd8e6ebf9bf4e8ca5b077958f051144
Closes-Bug: #1447528

commit_message:
add compute starter kit tag

This proposes a compute starter kit tag to specify a small number of
projects that are targeted at initial compute deploys by new
operators.

This is an evolution of the tag definition based on feedback provided
by folks that want to consume it, folks in favor, and folks
opposed. It makes for lengthy reading, but attempts to document the
questions that have been raised during the process.

Change-Id: Ie4aefe54a88aff9cebdf44e0e6c3f8ed95aa0d0e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/governance refs/changes/12/180112/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============== kernel:compute ============== A collection of projects required to build a functioning compute cloud in one of the most common ways that operators deploy OpenStack. Rationale ========= The OpenStack Mission Statement: "To produce the ubiquitous OpenSource Cloud Computing platform that will meet the needs of public and private clouds regardless of size, by being simple to implement and massively scalable." Many users come to OpenStack looking for a compute infrastructure for their datacenter. We should make it clear what the smallest reasonable starting point is to accomplish this, as that provides the best chance of success for the deployer getting something working. From this seed the deployers should then be able to expand the scope of their OpenStack deployment by plugging in additional components at a later date. Because the focus is initial deploy, the compute kernel should limit the complexity of the environment as much as possible, and not require multiple technology stacks. The compute kernel is assumed to need to support both long running snowflake workloads, as well as give experience with more "cloudy" ephemeral computes. Most users of initial deploy of OpenStack for compute will need both. Requirements ============ * All projects must be part of the integrated release Rationale: these users require that all components are actively cross tested with each other. * All projects must actively maintain stable branches Rationale: these users will typically deploy stable releases only, and upgrade on stable point releases before jumping to the next stable release. * All projects must only use relational database and queue system Rationale: providing HA stories for a relational database and Rabbit is substantial operational burden. Additional storage / messaging technologies provide too high an operational burden to meet for initial setup. * All projects must use oslo.config, oslo.log Rationale: both of these are operator in / out surfaces. All projects in here should have the same mechanisms for input / output from an operational standpoint. * All projects must support upgrade without config file change Rationale: the expected upgrade model is code upgrade on existing config files, cleaning up deprecation issues before upgrading to the next. * All projects must be a required element of "put this vm on the network". Rationale: we'd like to create a small enough starting point that getting everything up and running is a managable project. * All projects should be considered stable by the operator community * The projects in this tag should make it easy to add new OpenStack projects into such a deployment over time. Rationale: we'd like this to be a solid bit of 'seed corn' from which a larger and richer OpenStack deployement can be built out over time. Starting small with the ability to grow helps OpenStack adoption. Tag application process ======================= Under the current criteria the tag would apply to: - keystone - glance - nova (using nova-network multi host) - cinder Note: Neutron OVS tenant issolation complexity turns out to not be needed for a large number of users (especially smaller ones) and leads to substantial additional complexity and bugs. In an ideal world a Neutron simple mode that mirrors nova-network multi host (not using OVS) that could later be "upgraded" into OVS issolation would make this a candidate. Deprecation =========== No deprecation assumed, though there is the assumption that this concept will be revisited at every major release boundary for suitability. Attributes ========== No attributes Application to current projects =============================== As part of the application you need to go through the exercise of applying the proposed tag to at least some subset of the current project list. This will serve as an example of how the tag should be applied in the real world. You may also submit (as a subsequent change) the corresponding governance change to immediately apply the proposed tag to projects. .. tagged-projects:: <tag name>

commit_message:
Changes container_execute to container_exec

This is more consistent with the "docker exec" command,
and causes the user to do less typing, which they will appreciate.

commit_message:
Merge config_drive functional tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges config drive functional tests.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled for server tests to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.

Change-Id: I17d3a057f1cf97241ec7c259c6ce943e7523f0d9

commit_message:
Merge extension-info functional tests of v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges extension-info functional tests.

ExtensionInfoSamplesJsonTest is v3 only, leave it as before.

ExtensionInfoAllSamplesJsonTest, the response data is different,
tag the template files with version.

Change-Id: Id7b7bf08cda58d606325ddb82568a73f0bb99f60

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-21 16:06:12.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/2f63da9e0e0d0491acab31cafcee530ca0982e2e', 'message': "Ensure yum-utils is installed before using yum-config-manager

commit_message:
Ensure yum-utils is installed before using yum-config-manager

yum-utils provides yum-config-manager but the check for yum-utils is
currently being done after the first usage of yum-config-manager, which
fails if you don't have yum-utils already installed, so move it up
before the first usage of yum-config-manager.

Putting yum-utils in files/rpms/general doesn't help since
yum-config-manager is used in stack.sh before tools/install_prereqs.sh
is called.

Closes-Bug: #1467270

Change-Id: I74996c76838b7dc50d847e3bedb2d04dc55b4431
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/99/193899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_package_installed yum-utils || install_package yum-utils

commit_message:
Use elevated context for backup destroy

db.backup_destroy requires admin context to mark backup record as
deleted. Commit Icff37261b367463b71a1268be16f9c97f595bf0c removed admin
context passed to backup_destroy method.

This patch uses elevated context to destroy backup.
Change-Id: I75b9e1fff48569a8aa320f2f02914fc7b6665d79
Closes-Bug: #1467167
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/28/193828/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with self.obj_as_admin(): db.backup_destroy(self._context, self.id)

commit_message:
Add support for parameters to translate template

Some templates can have substitutions for values used throughout
the template. We should expose this feature via the command
line.

partially implements bp openstack-client-heat-translator

Change-Id: Iee4c21285afa77e7e5b36437928b3d62c10e465e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-translator refs/changes/43/191943/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from translator.osc import utils parser.add_argument( '--parameter', metavar='<key=value>', action=utils.KeyValueAction, help='Set a property for this template ' '(repeat option to set multiple properties)', ) if parsed_args.parameter: parsed_params = parsed_args.parameter else: parsed_params = {}
deleted_lines: # TODO(stevemar): parsed_params doesn't default nicely parsed_params = {}

commit_message:
Refactor _confirm_token_bind takes AccessInfo

Rather than pass token data in to _confirm_token_bind, pass the
AccessInfo.

This makes one less place where the token data is needed.

Change-Id: I84f7b97e6470a0eadcffe8d23acd6410c204326f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/76/179676/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: access_info = access.AccessInfo.factory(body=cached) self._confirm_token_bind(access_info, env) access_info = access.AccessInfo.factory(body=data) self._confirm_token_bind(access_info, env) def _confirm_token_bind(self, access_info, env): if access_info.version == 'v2.0': bind = access_info['token']['bind'] elif access_info.version == 'v3': bind = access_info['bind']
deleted_lines: self._confirm_token_bind(data, env) self._confirm_token_bind(data, env) def _confirm_token_bind(self, data, env): if _token_is_v2(data): bind = data['access']['token']['bind'] elif _token_is_v3(data): bind = data['token']['bind']

commit_message:
Remove not-currently-required amtterm dependency

The pxe_amt driver depends on the openwsman libs but not amtterm.
Remove this dependency since it isn't required at the moment and
isn't packaged for the RedHat-family systems we test on.

Change-Id: Ibc734846a580176df026b0929d2f5d52766a540e

commit_message:
Check for and install easy_install

On Ubuntu 14.04 at least, easy_install is not present by default.
We need to check for it, and if its not there, add it so we can
install pip.  Added a comment block noting the bug and rationale
for using the package manager to get a baseline setuptools.

Change-Id: Icf5434e828ce6c15968d1f46c19a9e11b33f4ed6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/00/193400/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ! $(easy_install --version &>/dev/null) ; then sudo -H apt-get -y install python-setuptools fi

commit_message:
Move VM state check post VIF required check

The VIF code determines if a VM is in a valid state for a plug vif, and
then determines if a plug vif is needed.  This can lead to odd scenarios
where the plug of the VIF will fail, when in fact no VIF plugs were
actually required.

This change set swaps the checks around to prevent this failure.

Change-Id: Ic759080fa2848eee179f322dd047bce3048624e8
Closes-Bug: 1466698

commit_message:
Don't install pbr in a venv

Because PIP_VIRTUAL_ENV was set for the installation of requirements,
and left around in scope, the installation of pbr no longer happened
in a global context, it instead landed inside the virtual
env. Unsetting the variable after requirements install gets us back to
where we expect.

This was an unintended side effect of the requirements-venv patch.

Change-Id: I2c4cb4305fec81a5fd237edabee78874ccd0da22
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/01/194401/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We use TRACK_DEPENDS=False because the whole and only point of installing # pbr here is to make it globally available. The .venv directory in our cwd # in grenade fools install_pip into using that venv rather than installing # globally, and so we don't actually get the latest pbr on the 'new' side of # grenade. TRACK_DEPENDS=False setup_lib "pbr" TRACK_DEPENDS=False pip_install "-U" "pbr"

commit_message:
Create puppet-openstack-integration repo

This repo will be the home for scripts and manifests for functional and
integration testing of the OpenStack Puppet Modules.

Change-Id: Ibb8a31f3d74df67289b2ee269e5080e9f912e2b6

commit_message:
Handle incorrect '--config-dir' param

This patch fixes the error that occurs if the --config-dir directory
doesn't exist. The exception ConfigDirNotFoundError should be caught
in this case.

Change-Id: Iee3fbd2b01de11124788e2c1df5c456c4010d234
Closes-Bug: #1255354
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/49/157749/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except cfg.ConfigDirNotFoundError as detail: print(detail) sys.exit(2) # If config files are not found in the requested directory. except cfg.ConfigFilesNotFound as detail2: print(detail2) sys.exit(2)

test case.

commit_message:
Fixes missing admin/user for devstack plugin

At some point a VAR we depended on was removed or changed upstream. This
patch updates to fixes that so the users fields are populated again.

Change-Id: Ie58b478d13b758e020df0655e6e3462ab4755f9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/62/193662/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add handler for ConnectsTo relationship
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-04 06:15:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat-translator/commit/f65002ce14daf956db16153f82d76741deb1f131', 'message': 'Add handler for ConnectsTo relationship

The ConnectsTo relationship in a node can have an interface that
contains the Configure relationship.  This interface would have
a lifecycle operation associated with it, something like a
configuration script requiring some input parameters.
In the Heat template, each of these lifecycle operation would
be implemented as a software config node.

commit_message:
Add handler for ConnectsTo relationship

The ConnectsTo relationship in a node can have an interface that
contains the Configure relationship.  This interface would have
a lifecycle operation associated with it, something like a
configuration script requiring some input parameters.
In the Heat template, each of these lifecycle operation would
be implemented as a software config node.
This patch adds the handler in the main translation loop to
process the ConnectsTo relationship.

Partially Implements: blueprint translate-tosca-monitoring-usecase
Change-Id: I5ca4b935cc8189ac46dca0d24a9aa8b40133928c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-translator refs/changes/73/188273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def handle_connectsto(self, tosca_target, hot_target, config_location, operation): # The ConnectsTo relationship causes a configuration operation in # the target. # This hot resource is the software config portion in the HOT template # This method adds the matching software deployment with the proper # target server and dependency if config_location == 'target': hosting_server = hot_target._get_hosting_server() elif config_location == 'source': hosting_server = self._get_hosting_server() deploy_name = self.nodetemplate.name + '_' + tosca_target.name + \ '_connect_deploy' sd_config = {'config': {'get_resource': self.name}, 'server': {'get_resource': hosting_server.name}} deploy_resource = \ HotResource(self.nodetemplate, deploy_name, 'OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment', sd_config, depends_on=[hot_target]) connect_inputs = self._get_connect_inputs(config_location, operation) if connect_inputs: deploy_resource.properties['input_values'] = connect_inputs return deploy_resource def _get_connect_inputs(self, config_location, operation): # this should be replaced by _get_lifecycle_inputs once # the interfaces for requirement is fixed in the parser if config_location == 'target': inputs = operation.get('pre_configure_target').get('inputs') elif config_location == 'source': inputs = operation.get('pre_configure_source').get('inputs') deploy_inputs = {} if inputs: for name, value in six.iteritems(inputs): deploy_inputs[name] = value return deploy_inputs

commit_message:
changed container bind mounts to use abspath

This change modifies the container create bind mounts to use the
absolute path that would be within the container instead of the
relitive path. This change is being done to ensure that there
are never issues with bind mounts as in newer versions of LXC and
the CGManager the absolute path is required.

Change-Id: I6af23c7ea0a7f905bdd587adde966a449402ed0a
Closes-Bug: #1462068

commit_message:
changed container bind mounts to use abspath

This change modifies the container create bind mounts to use the
absolute path that would be within the container instead of the
relitive path. This change is being done to ensure that there
are never issues with bind mounts as in newer versions of LXC and
the CGManager the absolute path is required.

Change-Id: I6af23c7ea0a7f905bdd587adde966a449402ed0a
Closes-Bug: #1462068
(cherry picked from commit a6536b132c06231773525ba73398091b937b390f)

commit_message:
Return timer after adding it to internal list

In some cases, its useful to selectively stop
some timers and not all. This fix allows a way
for client applications to maintain a handle
on timers and be able to stop some of them
selectively.

This is needed by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/190842/

Change-Id: Ie238615397a8dafe3c1f554d4a5166ad18fc8aca
Closes-Bug: 1466661

commit_message:
Rename image_id to image in container object

Currently, magnum used "image_id" to reflect the image in container,
but actually, we can support use both image name and image id to create
a container. The name "image_id" may confuse user that we only support
"image_id" when create a container.

This patch rename the "image_id" field to "image" in container object.

Change-Id: Ie3639feb2a2a90300662b74f186ef998d38d6cc4
Closes-Bug: #1466278
Closes-Bug: #1465558

commit_message:
Adding unit test coverage for the validate method

Adding a case in the existing unit tests to cover the ValueError
exception in the validate method of the GetInput classs. Also adding
a new yaml.

Change-Id: I9e7845e9ef5be15ea671155b22e60325e296302f
Closes-Bug: #1466657

commit_message:
Make token bind work with a request

The confirm token bind function takes the env dictionary. It should be
like other functions and operate on a request.

Change-Id: Id3bde0ef657cff6d1b2551e5a68245be71ccdb93
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystonemiddleware refs/changes/17/180817/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: user_token_info, request) serv_token, request) def _validate_token(self, token, request): :param request: incoming request self._confirm_token_bind(data, request) def _confirm_token_bind(self, data, req): if not req.environ.get('AUTH_TYPE', '').lower() == 'negotiate': if not req.environ.get('REMOTE_USER') == identifier:
deleted_lines: user_token_info, request.environ) serv_token, request.environ) def _validate_token(self, token, env): :param env: wsgi environment self._confirm_token_bind(data, env) def _confirm_token_bind(self, data, env): if not env.get('AUTH_TYPE', '').lower() == 'negotiate': if not env.get('REMOTE_USER') == identifier:

commit_message:
Adds OSSA-2015-012

Change-Id: I2500caa02a385ed1d6ac8131d8a7eee8361b3310
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ossa refs/changes/00/194700/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: date: 2015-06-23 id: OSSA-2015-012 title: 'Neutron L2 agent DoS through incorrect allowed address pairs' description: 'Darragh O''Reilly from HP reported a vulnerability in Neutron. By adding an address pair which is rejected as invalid by the ipset tool, an authenticated user may crash the Neutron L2 agent resulting in a denial of service attack. Neutron setups using the IPTables firewall driver are affected.' affected-products: - product: neutron version: 2014.2 versions through 2014.2.3 and 2015.1.0 version vulnerabilities: - cve-id: CVE-2015-3221 reporters: - name: 'Darragh O''Reilly' affiliation: HP reported: - CVE-2015-3221 issues: links: - https://launchpad.net/bugs/1461054 type: launchpad reviews: liberty: - https://review.openstack.org/194695 kilo: - https://review.openstack.org/194697 juno: - https://review.openstack.org/194696 type: gerrit notes: - 'This fix will be included in future 2014.2.4 (juno) and 2015.1.1 (kilo) releases.' - 'Zero prefixed address pair are not accepted by the Juno API, users need to use 0.0.0.0/1 and 128.0.0.1/1 or ::/1 and 8000::/1. The fix_zero_length_ip_prefix.py tool can be used to clean ports that were mis-configured with a zero prefixed address'

commit_message:
Rename _LOG to log in auth_token middleware

With the move to having a base class for auth_token middleware the log
object should be public. Rename the self._LOG attribute (which always
looked funny in caps as an attribute) to self.log.

Change-Id: Ib8050423eb712eb5d99a5be07d1ba5639c8d03c8

subject: network: add more debug logging context for race bug 1249065
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-16 18:26:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6488d26be2cba5416399c854f225a5e0d6505be2', 'message': 'network: add more debug logging context for race bug 1249065

The logging added in commit c13f42e36cddd820b475ffecf1f3a9e894d0cc04
shows that the instance.info_cache.network_info is empty when we fail to
associated a floating IP with an instance.

This change adds more logging in the network layer around things that
would affect the instance_info_cache.network_info value, such as
building the network info model in nova-network and allocate/deallocate
of a fixed IP.

From the logs we have when this fails, get_instance_nw_info is never
returning anything for the instance that fails, which may mean that when
the fixed IP is allocated and associated to the instance, there is a
race where the fixed IP record in the database is disassociated
asynchronously while deallocating from the previous instance it was
associated with.

Related-Bug: #1249065

Change-Id: I42f9af1dabffdc98e69d9eeeab1875098bc71bc0

commit_message:
network: add more debug logging context for race bug 1249065

The logging added in commit c13f42e36cddd820b475ffecf1f3a9e894d0cc04
shows that the instance.info_cache.network_info is empty when we fail to
associated a floating IP with an instance.

This change adds more logging in the network layer around things that
would affect the instance_info_cache.network_info value, such as
building the network info model in nova-network and allocate/deallocate
of a fixed IP.

From the logs we have when this fails, get_instance_nw_info is never
returning anything for the instance that fails, which may mean that when
the fixed IP is allocated and associated to the instance, there is a
race where the fixed IP record in the database is disassociated
asynchronously while deallocating from the previous instance it was
associated with.

Related-Bug: #1249065

Change-Id: I42f9af1dabffdc98e69d9eeeab1875098bc71bc0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/48/192348/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Change-Id: I19c44b0501f65a5f834ef34bccbe8f3a8728bd58

commit_message:
Use items() instead of iteritems() for validators

While it may be lighter to iterate, the dict will likely have fewer
than 10 items, so it doesn't have a practical impact. However using
.items() allows python3 compatibility without resorting to including
python-six for now.

Change-Id: I19c44b0501f65a5f834ef34bccbe8f3a8728bd58

commit_message:
Don't rely on set representation

Different versions of Python represent set as different text strings.
Join the values manually instead of relying on local implementation.

Change-Id: Idaab855151eccd140fa2597335c72bade171b71d

commit_message:
Docs: Use RFC5737 for Provider Networking

That'll make things more clear that with the provider networking
feature in DevStack, FIXED_RANGE will be a routed IPv4 subnet that gives
routed IPv4 addresses to instances without using floating IPs.

Change-Id: Ie26d75ac5ff285a25762c4f61fd9800b0382886b

added_lines: FIXED_RANGE="203.0.113.0/24"publicly routed IPv4 subnet. In this specific instance we are using the special NEST-NET-4 subnet defined in `RFC 5737 <http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5737>`_, which is used for documentation. In your DevStack setup, FIXED_RANGE would be a public IP address range that you or your organization has allocated to you, so that you could access your instances from the public internet.
deleted_lines: FIXED_RANGE="10.1.1.0/24"subnet that exists in the private RFC1918 address space - however in a real setup FIXED_RANGE would be a public IP address range, so that you could access your instances from the public internet.

commit_message:
Add support for HGST Solutions volumes to libvirt

Add a LibvirtHGSTVolumeDriver which can use Cinder volumes created
by the HGST volume driver.

Unit tests also added to appropriate class.

Prerequisites:
HGST Solutions needs to be installed and running on Nova node
Cinder patch @ https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186580/
OS-Brick patch @ https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186588/

Change-Id: I3ea615183a926148cb3f562022a0d8a38709f488
Implements: blueprint add-volume-driver-hgst-solutions
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/63/190663/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================================== Add a Nova volume driver for HGST Solutions Volumes =================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-volume-driver-hgst-solutions Add a Nova volume driver for the HGST Solutions software-defined SSD storage system. This will allos native HGST Spaces to connect to Nova instances to local and remote flash at full speed and high availabity. Problem description =================== HGST Solutions can pool all flash in a Nova cluster and carve them into redundant, block based LUNs. However, Nova cannot natively attach to these volumes. A Cinder driver and OS-Brick patch are in progress. Use Cases ---------- Operators can deploy HGST Storage based shared SSD for Nova compute nodes with high IO performance needs. Project Priority ----------------- None Proposed change =============== Add support for HGST Solutions to nova.virt.libvirt.volume.py by adding a new class LibvirtHGSTVolumeDriver based on the LibvirtBaseVolumeDriver. Attachment and detachment of storage will be done using the HGST Solutions CLI and require no special configuration options. After device attachment, LUNs will appear as devnodes as described by get_config. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- Operators wishing to use this will first need to add each Nova compute node into the HGST Solutions cluster. They need not all have flash for this to operate, though. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Other contributors: None Work Items ---------- Implementation completed and being verified by a Cinder CI system running tempest. Work placed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186594/ Dependencies ============ This driver requires the following Cinder volume driver to enable HGST Solutions volumes: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186580/ It also requires the following os-brick patch: http://www.hgst.com/software/HGST-flash-software-suite. History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Liberty - Introduced

commit_message:
Mask database.event_connection details in logs

In notification and collector logs, database connection
details are masked, but other connection strings are not.

This fix masks the event_connection, metering_connection
and alarm_connection strings.

Change-Id: Ib1fdc02e0c0d9cca1201f8304db4584d14498de1
Closes-Bug: #1456263

commit_message:
Edits to dev guide, juno guide, and kilo guide

-Added notes to assist whoever is using the guide for when they run into an error
that I previously encountered (repeatedly). Also changed the basic-config-sample.conf
to clean up the commented lines and added a sample pool configuration.
-Corrected a few typos in the guide for juno, and added clarification on how to
use the mysql command line.

--update2--
Made changes according to Tim's comments.
-Added back the commented lines to config sample file
-Removed Pool Backend Configs
-Added apt-get update to steps
-Updated mysql commands

--update4--
Minor change: deleted repeat in basic-config-sample.conf

--update5--
Added guide for Kilo using the ubuntu-dev guide with modifications as fit for the Kilo branch.

--update7--
-Shortened title
-removed random spacesx

--update8--
-removed line from basic-config file
-created config file specific to kilo
-renamed config file specific to juno
-edited doc with correct config file names

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/31/194731/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright 2013 Rackspace Hosting Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. ************************* Installing Kilo on Ubuntu ************************* .. _Development Environment: Development Environment +++++++++++++++++++++++ Installing Designate ==================== .. index:: double: install; designate 1. Install system package dependencies (Ubuntu) :: $ apt-get update $ apt-get install python-pip python-virtualenv git $ apt-get build-dep python-lxml 2. Clone the Designate repo from GitHub :: $ mkdir openstack $ cd openstack $ git clone https://github.com/openstack/designate.git $ cd designate 3. Checkout a specific version (in this case, the Kilo release) :: $ git checkout stable/kilo 4. Setup a virtualenv .. note:: This is an optional step, but will allow Designate's dependencies to be installed in a contained environment that can be easily deleted if you choose to start over or uninstall Designate. :: $ virtualenv --no-site-packages .venv $ . .venv/bin/activate 5. Install Designate and its dependencies .. note:: If you run into the error: Installed distribution pbr 1.1.1 conflicts with requirement pbr>=0.6,!=0.7,<1.0, try doing pip install pbr==0.11.0 :: $ pip install -r requirements.txt -r test-requirements.txt $ python setup.py develop If you run into the error: "Installed distribution oslo.config 1.9.3 conflicts with requirement oslo.config>=1.11.0", add the following into requirements.txt then repeat step 5: :: python-keystoneclient>=1.1.0,<1.4.0 pycadf>=0.8.0,<0.9.0 6. Change directories to the etc/designate folder. .. note:: Everything from here on out should take place in or below your designate/etc folder :: $ cd etc/designate 7. Create Designate's config files by copying the sample config files :: $ ls *.sample | while read f; do cp $f $(echo $f | sed "s/.sample$//g"); done 8. Make the directory for Designates log files :: $ mkdir -p ../../log 9. Make the directory for Designates state files :: $ mkdir -p ../../state Configuring Designate ====================== .. index:: double: configure; designate Open the designate.conf file for editing :: $ editor designate.conf Copy or mirror the configuration from this sample file here: .. literalinclude:: ../examples/basic-config-sample-kilo.conf :language: ini Installing RabbitMQ =================== .. note:: Do the following commands as "root" or via sudo <command> Install the RabbitMQ package :: $ apt-get install rabbitmq-server Create a user: :: $ rabbitmqctl add_user designate designate Give the user access to the / vhost: :: $ sudo rabbitmqctl set_permissions -p "/" designate ".*" ".*" ".*" Installing MySQL ================ .. index:: double: install; mysql Install the MySQL server package :: $ apt-get install mysql-server-5.5 If you do not have MySQL previously installed, you will be prompted to change the root password. By default, the MySQL root password for Designate is "password". You can: * Change the root password to "password" * If you want your own password, edit the designate.conf file and change any instance of "mysql://root:password@127.0.0.1/designate" to "mysql://root:YOUR_PASSWORD@127.0.0.1/designate" You can change your MySQL password anytime with the following command:: $ mysqladmin -u root -p password NEW_PASSWORD Enter password <enter your old password> Create the Designate tables :: $ mysql -u root -p Enter password: <enter your password here> mysql> CREATE DATABASE `designate` CHARACTER SET utf8 COLLATE utf8_general_ci; mysql> CREATE DATABASE `designate_pool_manager` CHARACTER SET utf8 COLLATE utf8_general_ci; mysql> exit; Install additional packages :: $ apt-get install libmysqlclient-dev $ pip install mysql-python Installing BIND9 ================ .. index:: double: install; bind9 Install the DNS server, BIND9 :: $ apt-get install bind9 # Update the BIND9 Configuration $ editor /etc/bind/named.conf.options # Change the corresponding lines in the config file: options { directory "/var/cache/bind"; dnssec-validation auto; auth-nxdomain no; # conform to RFC1035 listen-on-v6 { any; }; allow-new-zones yes; request-ixfr no; recursion no; }; # Disable AppArmor for BIND9 $ touch /etc/apparmor.d/disable/usr.sbin.named $ service apparmor reload # Restart BIND9: $ service bind9 restart Initialize & Start the Central Service ====================================== .. index:: double: install; central Sync the Designate database. :: $ designate-manage database sync Start the central service. :: $ designate-central You'll now be seeing the log from the central service. Initialize & Start the API Service ================================== .. index:: double: install; api Open up a new ssh window and log in to your server (or however youre communicating with your server). :: $ cd openstack/designate # Make sure your virtualenv is sourced $ source .venv/bin/activate # Start the API Service $ designate-api Youll now be seeing the log from the API service. Initialize & Start the Pool Manager Service =========================================== .. index:: double: install; pool-manager Open up a new ssh window and log in to your server (or however youre communicating with your server). :: # Sync the Pool Manager's cache: $ designate-manage pool-manager-cache sync # Start the pool manager service: $ designate-pool-manager You'll now be seeing the log from the Pool Manager service. Initialize & Start the MiniDNS Service =========================================== .. index:: double: install; minidns Open up a new ssh window and log in to your server (or however youre communicating with your server). :: # Start the minidns service: $ designate-mdns You'll now be seeing the log from the MiniDNS service. Exercising the API ================== .. note:: If you have a firewall enabled, make sure to open port 53, as well as Designate's default port (9001). Using a web browser, curl statement, or a REST client, calls can be made to the Designate API using the following format where "api_version" is either v1 or v2 and "command" is any of the commands listed under the corresponding version at :ref:`rest` :: http://IP.Address:9001/api_version/command You can find the IP Address of your server by running :: curl -s checkip.dyndns.org | sed -e 's/.*Current IP Address: //' -e 's/<.*$//' A couple of notes on the API: - Before Domains are created, you must create a server (/v1/servers).

Fix the meter unit types to be consistent

The unit types for certain meters generated from
pollsters are not consistent with the once generated
via notifications. This fix handles the mismatch.

subject: Use oslo_messaging directly for osprofiler
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-23 16:09:19.000000000', 'files': ['glance/cmd/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/98495cb1cffdd98729a3159f063d74c88eb21331', 'message': "Use oslo_messaging directly for osprofiler

When oslo removed namespaced packages in kilo, we changed our code in
glance.notifier from doing

    from oslo import messaging

To doing

    import oslo_messaging

And we changed all references from messaging to oslo_messaging. When
osprofiler integration was added, the author chose to use the notifier
module's reference to oslo.messaging instead of importing it directly.
When the rename occurred, this was not caught. So we import
oslo_messaging directly in glance.cmd.api and use it as it was intended

Closes-bug: 1467982
Change-Id: I32263252ee8d7fd9b70965ab967c4a2c33c928af
"}]
commit_message:
Use oslo_messaging directly for osprofiler

When oslo removed namespaced packages in kilo, we changed our code in
glance.notifier from doing

    from oslo import messaging

To doing

    import oslo_messaging

And we changed all references from messaging to oslo_messaging. When
osprofiler integration was added, the author chose to use the notifier
module's reference to oslo.messaging instead of importing it directly.
When the rename occurred, this was not caught. So we import
oslo_messaging directly in glance.cmd.api and use it as it was intended

Closes-bug: 1467982
Change-Id: I32263252ee8d7fd9b70965ab967c4a2c33c928af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/25/194725/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import oslo_messaging oslo_messaging, {},

commit_message:
Move Server.created to created_at

Other resources have timestamps with an "_at" suffix, which makes more
sense to converge on than without the suffix, otherwise it looks like a
boolean name.

Change-Id: I9097d0309ce3bbf6340fbce623321c6d41cf57c7
Closes-Bug: 1435880
