subject: Add support for deploying Keystone with Fernet
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-22 15:41:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/9ad608a53585d3cbddb2e834188059dae7d01979', 'message': 'Add support for deploying Keystone with Fernet

This change adds a number of new tasks that are dependent on the value
of the Keystone token provider (keystone_token_provider) user variable.

If the keystone_token_provider user_variable is set to
keystone.token.providers.fernet.Provider then the playbooks will
appropriately create the fernet keys and distribute them to the rest of
the keystone containers.

This also implements key rotation for generated fernet keys similar to
how the os_nova roles implement key rotation.

Finally, we also need to build cryptography from master for now.
Currently, 0.8.x and 0.9.x use versions of cffi<1.0 which causes a bug
when used with mod_wsgi and Apache. This is fixed in cryptography master
and will be released in 1.0.

Closes-bug: 1463569
Change-Id: I8605e0490a8889d57c6b1b7e03e078fb0da978ab

commit_message:
Add support for deploying Keystone with Fernet

This change adds a number of new tasks that are dependent on the value
of the Keystone token provider (keystone_token_provider) user variable.

If the keystone_token_provider user_variable is set to
keystone.token.providers.fernet.Provider then the playbooks will
appropriately create the fernet keys and distribute them to the rest of
the keystone containers.

This also implements key rotation for generated fernet keys similar to
how the os_nova roles implement key rotation.

Finally, we also need to build cryptography from master for now.
Currently, 0.8.x and 0.9.x use versions of cffi<1.0 which causes a bug
when used with mod_wsgi and Apache. This is fixed in cryptography master
and will be released in 1.0.

Closes-bug: 1463569
Change-Id: I8605e0490a8889d57c6b1b7e03e078fb0da978ab
(cherry picked from commit 9ad608a53585d3cbddb2e834188059dae7d01979)

commit_message:
Revert "Adding support for neutron-debug CLI."

There isn't a reason to have a function to call this command
live in tempest-lib. The neutron-debug CLI is only used for
local debug and isn't actually a client. It's for running
locally on the same node as neutron. It's completely out of
scope for living in tempest-lib. Just because there is a
CLI for something in an OpenStack project running doesn't
mean we need to have a dedicated function to call it. It's
a simple matter to locally subclass the CLIClient class and
add local functions to call commands for a particular test
suite. 

So let's revert this before it's included in a release. If
it were to be included in a release the effort to remove it
goes up quite a bit, because we need a proper deprecation
cycle.

This reverts commit 43c45b2b9dc6b5369556feb94431ed3e22185d34.

Change-Id: I8e77dd92abd482e6cdbaceff81dc12b9f224e2ec
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest-lib refs/changes/74/194674/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def neutron_debug(self, action, flags='', params='', fail_ok=False, endpoint_type='publicURL', merge_stderr=False): """Executes neutron-debug command for the given action. :param action: the cli command to run using neutron :type action: string :param flags: any optional cli flags to use :type flags: string :param params: any optional positional args to use :type params: string :param fail_ok: if True an exception is not raised when the cli return code is non-zero :type fail_ok: boolean :param endpoint_type: the type of endpoint for the service :type endpoint_type: string :param merge_stderr: if True the stderr buffer is merged into stdout :type merge_stderr: boolean """ return execute( 'neutron-debug', action, flags, params, fail_ok, merge_stderr, self.cli_dir)

commit_message:
Add logic to pass sg and sg-rules to ODL

This adds back the code to pass sg and sg-rules into ODL. In addition
to the original code, this also utilizes method functions instead of
module functions, as weakref is now supported in the callback
layer.

This reverts commit d446fcd8f01e5d210b5c43f34ed9241fe31f663a.

Change-Id: I4c22db3b3d78ba060d55ea759d8751115bf9df57
Co-Authored-By: Flavio Fernandes <ffernand@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-odl refs/changes/25/178325/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ODL_SG = 'security_group' ODL_SGS = 'security_groups' ODL_SG_RULE = 'security_group_rule' ODL_SG_RULES = 'security_group_rules'

commit_message:
oslo incubator sync

Import the latest oslo incubator code.
Imported from commit f2cfbba78c0bfb5d48f32d86182f3e39f317ec82

openstack.common.log is used only by openstack.common.policy now.
It can be deleted when Horizon consumes policy from openstack_auth.
Until then we need to keep openstack.common.log in the tree.

Change-Id: I716625b4ae44da7bb0372af82b48ac5e06266616

deleted_lines: from openstack_dashboard.openstack.common import log as logging def ensure_tree(path): os.makedirs(path)

commit_message:
Add id function extractor to datasource driver

Previously, there was no way to build a custom identifier
when translating an API call result into tables.  The
only options were to specify a column name or to have
an ID generated for you.

This change makes it possible to specify a function that
given the object returns an ID.

Implements-blueprint: datasource-driver-custom-id
Change-Id: I9ff134ef56fb118ba846fcdef11a656e25435df6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress refs/changes/79/192479/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Instead, if 'id-col' is specified, the translator will prepend a generated id column to each row. The 'id-col' value can be either a string indicating an id should be generated based on the hash of the remaining fields, or it is a function that takes as argument the object and returns an ID as a string or number. If 'id-col' is specified with a sub-translator, that value is included as a column in the top-level translator's table. Using both parent-key and id-col at the same time is redudant, so DataSourceDriver will reject that configuration. ID_COL_NAME = 'id_col' columns.append(cls._id_col_name(id_col)) new_schema = (cls._id_col_name(id_col),) + new_schema schema[tablename] = (cls._id_col_name(id_col), value_col) def _compute_id(cls, id_col, obj, args): """Compute the ID for an object and return it.""" # ID is generated via a hash if isinstance(id_col, basestring): value = cls._compute_hash(args) # ID is computed by a datasource-provided function else: value = id_col(obj) assert (isinstance(value, basestring) or isinstance(value, (int, long, float))), ( "ID must be string or number") return value @classmethod def _id_col_name(cls, id_col): """Compute name for the ID column given id_col value.""" if isinstance(id_col, basestring): return id_col return cls.ID_COL_NAME @classmethod h = cls._compute_id(id_col, obj, converted_values) h = cls._compute_id(id_col, o, row_hashes) h = cls._compute_id(id_col, obj, converted_items) h = cls._compute_id(id_col, obj, vdict_rows) return cls._format_results_to_hdict( obj, new_results, translator, hdict_row) def _format_results_to_hdict(cls, obj, results, translator, hdict_row): h = cls._compute_id(id_col, obj, new_row)

Using both parent-key and id-col at the same time is redudant, so DataSourceDriver will reject that configuration. columns.append(id_col) new_schema = (id_col,) + new_schema schema[tablename] = (id_col, value_col) h = cls._compute_hash(converted_values) h = cls._compute_hash(row_hashes) h = cls._compute_hash(converted_items) h = cls._compute_hash(vdict_rows) return cls._format_results_to_hdict(new_results, translator, hdict_row) def _format_results_to_hdict(cls, results, translator, hdict_row): h = cls._compute_hash(new_row)

added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Add Action Listing to api ========================================== Just as the API allows us to query the available tables that a datasource provides, it should be possible to query the available actions that a datasource can execute. Problem description =================== Currently, datasources have the ability to execute actions, but there is no api call to ask what the available actions are. Proposed change =============== Add an API call that returns the list of available actions. This requires adding a method to the congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py:ExecutionDriver class that returns the list of actions that the datasource will execute. It would be nice if the ExecutionDriver also enforced that it only executed the actions in that list. One might consider trying to auto-generate the list of actions based on the methods available in the python-client being used (for those datasources using a python-client). Alternatives ------------ The alternative is to provide no API and ask people to consult the documentation to find the list of available actions. This is more attractive than it sounds because it gives us the freedom to execute any action that the python-client for the underlying datasource exposes. If someone adds a new method for the python-client then a policy writer immediately gets access to that method, without requiring any changes in Congress. The downside to this approach is that end-users need to understand which python client they are using within each datasource driver and then look up the docs for that python client. So in terms of usability, it's pretty terrible. Policy ------ N/A Policy actions -------------- N/A Data sources ------------ N/A Data model impact ----------------- There should be no data-model impact, since the added information is implemented as part of the datasource driver, not stored in the database. REST API impact --------------- GET /v1/data-sources/<datasource-id>/actions Should error if the datasource does not implement the proper method. Result should be an array of dicts, where each dict describes an action: [{'name': <action-name>, 'args': <list-of-parameter-names>}] The assignee is free to extend the fields of an action to include additional meta-information, such as a description of what the action does, or a description of what each of the parameters are. Security impact --------------- N/A Notifications impact -------------------- N/A Other end user impact --------------------- Need to add similar functionality to the python-congressclient. Performance impact ------------------ N/A Other deployer impact --------------------- N/A Developer impact ---------------- N/A Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <launchpad-id or None> Other contributors: <launchpad-id or None> Work items ---------- 0. Modify API design doc (linked from the wiki) 1. Add method to ExecutionDriver in congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py 2. Add call handler in congress/harness.py 3. Add route call in congress/api/router.py 4. Add API implementation to congress/api/action_model.py 5. Update python-congressclient Dependencies ============ N/A Testing ======= - Unit tests for API to congress/tests/test_congress.py - Unit tests for ExecutionDriver Documentation impact ==================== Add API call References ========== N/A

commit_message:
libvirt: virtio-net multiqueue

Add support to enable the virtio-net multi queue.

blueprint libvirt-virtio-net-multiqueue

Change-Id: I0fbe9321889bdaa7e91c73e3fa9b19966c0f05d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/25/128825/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== libvirt: virtio-net multiqueue ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/virtio-net-multiqueue This blueprint aims to enhance the libvirt driver to enable the virtio-net multiqueue. This will allow the guest instances to increase the total network throughput. Problem description =================== Today's high-end servers have more processors, and guests running on them often have an increasing number of vCPUs. In single queue virtio-net, the scale of the protocol stack in a guest is restricted, as the network performance does not scale as the number of vCPUs increases. Guests cannot transmit or retrieve packets in parallel, as virtio-net has only one TX and RX queue. Multiqueue virtio-net provides the greatest performance benefit when: - Traffic packets are relatively large. - The guest is active on many connections at the same time, with traffic running between guests, guest to host, or guest to an external system. - The number of queues is equal to the number of vCPUs. This is because multi-queue support optimizes RX interrupt affinity and TX queue selection in order to make a specific queue private to a specific vCPU. Although the virtio-net multiqueue feature provides a performance benefit, it has some limitations: - Multiqueue virtio-net works well for incoming traffic, but can occasionally hurt performance for outgoing traffic. - Enabling multiqueue virtio-net increases the total network throughput, and in parallel increases CPU consumption. Project Priority ----------------- None Proposed change =============== In order to address the problem, an administrator should have the control to allow the paralleled packet processing by enabling the multiqueue support or disable it, for cetrain workloads, where this feature will only lead to a reduced performance. Introducing a new paramenter to the flavour extra specs, for the administrator to control the virtio-net multiqueue feature. hw:vif_multiqueue_enabled = true|false Users will also be able to override the setting in extra specs and disable the feature, if it has been enabled, by using the following image metadata property: hw_vif_multiqueue_enabled = true|false The Libvirt driver will be enhanced to match the number of virtio-net queues to the number of VCPUs. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None. Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: vladik.romanovsky@enovance.com Work Items ---------- Update the vif config file to set the correct number of VCPUs to virtio-net devices Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= Unit tests. Documentation Impact ==================== None. References ========== http://www.linux-kvm.org/page/Multiqueue

ObjectVersionChecker just needs a list of classes, we don't need

commit_message:
Decouple ObjectVersionChecker and VersionedObjectRegistry

ObjectVersionChecker just needs a list of classes, we don't need
to check the base.VersionedObjectRegistry everytime, so just
initialize the list of classes in the constructor and default
it to the base.VersionedObjectRegistry to get the current
behavior. Will make it easy to run ObjectVersionChecker against
custom registries.

Change-Id: I700daa278473dff5285e0b21afffc03671e390f9

commit_message:
Add disk layout check on re-provisioning

The preserve ephemeral logic does not check whether the
disk layout was changed since the last time the node was
provisioned. Additionally we have introduced a 
driver_internal_info['instance'] object to store instance's
disk configration and which is purged when tearing down an
instance.

Change-Id: Iecdb8db37b22c37275be3197950bbf899aa62a53
Closes-Bug: #1327260
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/14/180014/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: instance_info = node.instance_info driver_internal_info = node.driver_internal_info instance_info.get('image_source')): # Check whether disk layout changed. if instance_info.get('preserve_ephemeral'): if (driver_internal_info.get('root_gb', '0') != instance_info.get('root_gb', '0') or driver_internal_info.get('ephemeral_gb') != instance_info.get('ephemeral_gb', '0') or driver_internal_info.get('swap_mb', '0') != instance_info.get('swap_mb', '0')): raise exception.InstanceDeployFailure(_( "RPC do_node_deploy failed to check rebuild disk " "layout.")) # Note(Zhenguo) Add disk layout here, in case of rebuild # with preserve_ephemeral option, then we can check whether # the disk layout was changed since the last time the node # was provisioned. driver_internal_info['root_gb'] = (instance_info. get('root_gb', '0')) driver_internal_info['ephemeral_gb'] = (instance_info. get('ephemeral_gb', '0')) driver_internal_info['swap_mb'] = (instance_info. get('swap_mb', '0')) iwdi = images.is_whole_disk_image(context, instance_info)
deleted_lines: node.instance_info.get('image_source')): instance_info = node.instance_info driver_internal_info = node.driver_internal_info iwdi = images.is_whole_disk_image(context, node.instance_info)

subject: Sync amqp support with other openstack modules
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-01 15:28:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-trove/commit/06d3f6b5d952290969018f6b08bf30acf0172cc1', 'message': "Sync amqp support with other openstack modules

Kilo oslo-messaging deprecates rabbit/kombu settings in the
DEFAULT section.

Rabbitmq won't talk to us anymore if we try to use SSLv3 as it disabled
support for SSLv3. Openstack components use python's openssl
implementation which does not support TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 yet so we
just switch to TLSv1. Support for newer TLS should come with python
2.7.9+

The kombu_ssl_* parameters should not be required when rabbit_use_ssl => true
Rather, rabbit_use_ssl must be set to true if the kombu_ssl_* parameters are
used.

Change-Id: I327dc193d878cb1574b69d5f5b502c25fa203a66
Closes-Bug: #1409667 #1356083
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-02 15:21:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-trove/commit/f9d85f363e127eb1c93f61fa0cab6b5fc6132410', 'message': "Sync amqp support with other openstack modules

commit_message:
Sync amqp support with other openstack modules

Kilo oslo-messaging deprecates rabbit/kombu settings in the
DEFAULT section.

Rabbitmq won't talk to us anymore if we try to use SSLv3 as it disabled
support for SSLv3. Openstack components use python's openssl
implementation which does not support TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 yet so we
just switch to TLSv1. Support for newer TLS should come with python
2.7.9+

The kombu_ssl_* parameters should not be required when rabbit_use_ssl => true
Rather, rabbit_use_ssl must be set to true if the kombu_ssl_* parameters are
used.

Change-Id: I327dc193d878cb1574b69d5f5b502c25fa203a66
Closes-Bug: #1409667
Closes-Bug: #1356083

commit_message:
Introduce public_url(_s3), internal_url(_s3) and admin_url(_s3)

This change deprecates the following parameters:
- endpoint_prefix: replaced by public/internal/admin_url
- port: replaced by public/internal/admin_url(_s3)
- public_port: replaced by public_url(_s3)
- public_protocol:  replaced by public_url(_s3)
- public_address: replaced by public_url(_s3)
- public_port: replaced by public_url
- internal_protocol: replaced by internal_url
- internal_address: replaced by internal_url
- admin_protocol: replaced by admin_url
- admin_address: replaced by admin_url

Add deprecation warnings if any of those values are provided
while maintaining full backward compatibility.

Co-Authored-By: David Moreau Simard <dmsimard@iweb.com>
Co-Authored-By: Richard Raseley <richard@raseley.com>
Closes-bug: #1274979
Change-Id: Ie4afc21ac6e9539edd70635de7f3db957a22467e

added_lines: # [*auth_name*] # (Optional) The name of the user. (Defaults to 'swift')# (Optional) The user's password. (Defaults to 'swift_password') # # [*tenant*] # (Optional) The user's tenant. (Defaults to 'services') # # [*email*] # (Optional) The user's e-mail. (Defaults to 'swift@localhost') # # [*region*] # (Optional) The endpoint region. (Defaults to 'RegionOne')# (Optional) List of roles swift considers as admin. (Defaults to ['admin', 'SwiftOperator']) # # [*public_url*] # (Optional) The endpoint's public url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:8080') # This url should *not* contain any API version and no trailing '/'. # # [*internal_url*] # (Optional) The endpoint's internal url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:8080') # This url should *not* contain any API version and no trailing '/'. # # [*admin_url*] # (Optional) The endpoint's admin url. (Defaults to 'http://127.0.0.1:8080') # This url should *not* contain any API version and no trailing '/'. # # [*port*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use public_url, internal_url and admin_url instead. # Default port for endpoints. # Setting this parameter overrides public_url, internal_url and admin_url parameters. # # [*public_protocol*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use public_url instead. # The public endpoint protocol. (ex: http/https) # # [*public_address*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use public_url instead. # The public endpoint address. # # [*public_port*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use public_url instead. # The public endpoint port. # # [*internal_protocol*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use internal_url instead. # The internal endpoint protocol. (ex: http/https) # # [*internal_address*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use internal_url instead. # The internal endpoint address.# # # [*admin_protocol*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use admin_url instead. # The admin endpoint protocol. (ex: http/https) # # [*admin_address*] # (optional) DEPRECATED: Use admin_url instead. # The admin endpoint address. # # === Deprecation notes # If any value is provided for public_protocol, public_address or port parameters, # public_url will be completely ignored. The same applies for internal and admin parameters. # # === Examples # class { 'swift::keystone::auth': # public_url => 'https://10.0.0.10:8080', # internal_url => 'https://10.0.0.11:8080', # admin_url => 'https://10.0.0.11:8080', # } $public_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:8080', $internal_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:8080', $admin_url = 'http://127.0.0.1:8080', # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $port = undef, $public_protocol = undef, $public_address = undef, $internal_protocol = undef, $internal_address = undef, $admin_protocol = undef, if $port { warning('The port parameter is deprecated, use public_url, internal_url and admin_url instead.') } if $public_protocol { warning('The public_protocol parameter is deprecated, use public_url instead.') } if $public_address { warning('The public_address parameter is deprecated, use public_url instead.') } if $internal_protocol { warning('The internal_protocol parameter is deprecated, use internal_url instead.') } if $internal_address { warning('The internal_address parameter is deprecated, use internal_url instead.') } if $admin_protocol { warning('The admin_protocol parameter is deprecated, use admin_url instead.') } if $admin_address { warning('The admin_address parameter is deprecated, use admin_url instead.') } $public_url_real = inline_template('<%= if (!@public_protocol.nil?) || (!@public_address.nil?) || (!@port.nil?) @public_protocol ||= "http" @public_address ||= "127.0.0.1" @port ||= "8080" "#{@public_protocol}://#{@public_address}:#{@port}" else @public_url end %>') $internal_url_real = inline_template('<%= if (!@internal_protocol.nil?) || (!@internal_address.nil?) || (!@port.nil?) @internal_protocol ||= "http" @internal_address ||= "127.0.0.1" @port ||= "8080" "#{@internal_protocol}://#{@internal_address}:#{@port}" else @internal_url end %>') $admin_url_real = inline_template('<%= if (!@admin_protocol.nil?) || (!@admin_address.nil?) || (!@port.nil?) @admin_protocol ||= "http" @admin_address ||= "127.0.0.1" @port ||= "8080" "#{@admin_protocol}://#{@admin_address}:#{@port}" else @admin_url end %>') public_url => "${public_url_real}/v1/AUTH_%(tenant_id)s", internal_url => "${internal_url_real}/v1/AUTH_%(tenant_id)s", admin_url => "${admin_url_real}/", public_url => $public_url_real, internal_url => $internal_url_real, admin_url => $admin_url_real, }
deleted_lines: # [*auth_user*] # String. The name of the user. # Optional. Defaults to 'swift'.# String. The user's password. # Optional. Defaults to 'swift_password'.# Array of strings. List of roles Swift considers as admin. $port = '8080', $public_protocol = 'http', $public_address = '127.0.0.1', $admin_protocol = 'http', $internal_protocol = 'http', $internal_address = undef if ! $public_port { $real_public_port = $port } else { $real_public_port = $public_port } if ! $admin_address { $real_admin_address = $public_address } else { $real_admin_address = $admin_address } if ! $internal_address { $real_internal_address = $public_address } else { $real_internal_address = $internal_address } public_url => "${public_protocol}://${public_address}:${real_public_port}/v1/AUTH_%(tenant_id)s", admin_url => "${admin_protocol}://${real_admin_address}:${port}/", internal_url => "${internal_protocol}://${real_internal_address}:${port}/v1/AUTH_%(tenant_id)s", public_url => "${public_protocol}://${public_address}:${real_public_port}", admin_url => "${admin_protocol}://${real_admin_address}:${port}", internal_url => "${internal_protocol}://${real_internal_address}:${port}", }

With the advent of PBR 0.11.0 all repos using it generate
3-component release or 4-component pre-release versioned tarballs
and wheels. Our release automation driven from Zuul needs to be able
to assume that the versions on these artifacts match the tags
themselves. Restrict triggering the pre-release and release

Change-Id: I7ffdeee8a398a4914e1566de4c2cc7f637da6ec9

commit_message:
Only support PBR>=0.11.0 semver release tags

With the advent of PBR 0.11.0 all repos using it generate
3-component release or 4-component pre-release versioned tarballs
and wheels. Our release automation driven from Zuul needs to be able
to assume that the versions on these artifacts match the tags
themselves. Restrict triggering the pre-release and release
pipelines to only tags in a format PBR>=0.11.0 will generate.

Change-Id: I7ffdeee8a398a4914e1566de4c2cc7f637da6ec9

commit_message:
Asynchronous Zone Import

* Creates /v2/zones/tasks/imports, which allows users to view imports as resources
* Creates new database table zone_tasks for asynchronous tasks related to zones, along
with the associated objects/adapters
* Imports are done by passing over the request body, creating an async record in the db,
and spawning a thread to do the import
* Adds a config option to enable zone import

Implements: async-import-export
APIImpact: Adds /zones/tasks/imports and removes import from admin api

commit_message:
Add manage_service parameter to all agents::ml2 classes that did not yet have it.

This existed in the older agents::ovs and agents::linuxbridge classes
which were recently removed, adding here for consistency.

When set to false, enables puppet to configure a service without
starting/stopping it on each run.  This may be necessary when
using an external clustering system (Corosync/Pacemaker, for
example).  Defaults to true.

Change-Id: I3242f790e7d3231a81b447c10aa2d741b7b68a3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/77/194177/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Revert "glance provider: pick os_region_name from DEFAULT"

This reverts commit b76fbcbea34b510191964cc3ed6a4c8e6f2acbfe.

With 268370457c118e62b93990cea31066c477ab0dbc now merged, we need to go
back to looking for os_region_name in [glance_store] instead of
[DEFAULT].

Change-Id: I197d012387d630ca6fb3a38c48f0603add6c6de1

commit_message:
Always allow removing instance_uuid from node in maintenance mode

This will help to dissociate node from nova instance in cases like
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1229401

Closes-Bug: #1465153
Change-Id: I9c736612d7a526e58ea2af5e7296e80354550bdc

commit_message:
cells: add devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc for gating

We need to whittle down the large regex of excluded tests for the
tempest-dsvm-cells job but we also need to be able to test changes to
the regex, like removing entries that we think are now working.

This change moves the regex from project-config in the
tempest-dsvm-cells job definition to nova so that nova can control and
test the changes on it's own, since project-config is not currently able
to self-test job changes.

project-config change: I8cbc36266eadaf0dbef20e3e83f4874bcfc9ab3a

Change-Id: I2365619de4ba7b43a049771bac90d2deebaa3e9c

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-23 14:22:06.000000000', 'files': ['milestone.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/release-tools/commit/d63c3eeaace285e4352b58992012c8a5dc585272', 'message': 'Fix version determination in corner cases

The initial "version = " grep could pick up extra lines. Anchor it

Change-Id: I5289a0a0997fc1618b65bcf1c9a5577bc7094cb7

commit_message:
Fix version determination in corner cases

The initial "version = " grep could pick up extra lines. Anchor it
at the start of the line so that it only gets "version = " and not
"foobar.version = ".

Change-Id: I5289a0a0997fc1618b65bcf1c9a5577bc7094cb7

subject: upload_release.py should use $VERSION.0b1 too

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-23 13:46:11.000000000', 'files': ['upload_release.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/release-tools/commit/9ab31aa161fc4c5c066e068aa89f320e11e74887', 'message': 'upload_release.py should use $VERSION.0b1 too

To further align with the canonical form of PEP440, pre-versions
leading to $VERSION should no longer be ${VERSION}b1 but
${VERSION}.0b1.

The logic to determine that is duplicated in upload_release.py, so

Change-Id: Ic0bb8f5e9ba31370cd495f4396eb1b1306e06911

commit_message:
upload_release.py should use $VERSION.0b1 too

To further align with the canonical form of PEP440, pre-versions
leading to $VERSION should no longer be ${VERSION}b1 but
${VERSION}.0b1.

The logic to determine that is duplicated in upload_release.py, so
until we rearchitect that that needs to be fixed there too.

Change-Id: Ic0bb8f5e9ba31370cd495f4396eb1b1306e06911

commit_message:
Could not find resource Service[undef] for relationship from Package.

Original variables were not assign any value. Therefore puppet will try
to find Service[undef].

Adjust those service's title to correctly parameter location at
ceilometer's class.

Change-Id: Ibef8410848076bc0bc7d7824b28e93efad02a231
Closes-Bug: #1455029

commit_message:
Adding support for neutron-debug CLI.

This Patch adds code support for neutron-debug CLI command.

Change-Id: Ief1b609392af954bfa45d175a817799c63f9fd7d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest-lib refs/changes/56/173756/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def neutron_debug(self, action, flags='', params='', fail_ok=False, endpoint_type='publicURL', merge_stderr=False): """Executes neutron-debug command for the given action. :param action: the cli command to run using neutron :type action: string :param flags: any optional cli flags to use :type flags: string :param params: any optional positional args to use :type params: string :param fail_ok: if True an exception is not raised when the cli return code is non-zero :type fail_ok: boolean :param endpoint_type: the type of endpoint for the service :type endpoint_type: string :param merge_stderr: if True the stderr buffer is merged into stdout :type merge_stderr: boolean """ flags += ' --endpoint-type %s' % endpoint_type return self.cmd_with_auth( 'neutron-debug', action, flags, params, fail_ok, merge_stderr, self.cli_dir)

commit_message:
Spec for adding audit capability using CADF specification.

Moved to Liberty.
Adding audit middleware option emitting CADF events.
Clarified testing details are requested in review comments.

Change-Id: I4692f183190ed6e4d364bd7d69e0db65f9232094
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-specs refs/changes/38/159938/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================================== Add auditing capability via CADF based notification events ========================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/barbican/+spec/audit-cadf-events This proposal is to add auditing capability in Barbican using CADF (Cloud Audit Data Federation) specification. The idea is to identify auditable attributes and construct audit data record as per CADF event specifiction and provide delivery option via OpenStack notification framework to interested services and consumers. DMTF CADF (Cloud Auditing Data Federation) standard provides auditing capabilities for compliance with security, operational and business processes. See References section in end for more details around CADF specification. Problem Description =================== Large number of enterprise faces challenge when moving to OpenStack cloud. And most of these challenges have nothing to do with OpenStack service capabilities. Instead, the challenges are in terms of auditing and monitoring their workload and data in accordance with their strict corporate, industry or regional policies and compliance requirements (FIPS-140-2, PCI-DSS, SoX, ISO 27017 etc). Barbican, being a security component in a cloud, has similar auditing requirement. In addition, Barbican has this concept of soft deletes where it keeps resources in database even after they are marked deleted and are no longer used in live systems. The idea is to have a sense of audit trail of its resources state. This approach does not provide much value in terms of audit other than when it was marked deleted. Proposed Change =============== To add auditing capability in Barbican, proposal is to leverage a existing standard instead of creating own semantics and audit data model. In OpenStack ecosystem, number of services (Ceilometer, Keystone) are using CADF based event data model to report activities on its resources. Using CADF standard for auditing will allow consistent reporting across services and will allow customers to use common audit tools and processes for their audit data. The CADF model can answer critical questions about activity or event happening on rest resources in a normative manner using CADF's seven W's of auditing (What, When, Who, On What, Where, From Where, To Where). See Auditing Event Details section below. The overhead of adding audit data interaction can be minimized by publishing audit event as OpenStack notifications where event publisher does not have to wait for response/ acknowledgment. This way audit event delivery is decoupled and can still benefit from messaging infrastructure durability and delivery guarantees. Auditing Event Details ----------------------- The proposal is to add decorator on Barbican controller rest apis to gather event data. Event data is constructed using who initiated request, request outcome, resource operated on, resource identifier and event type information. Following is sample of seven W's of auditing values for Barbican rest resources. +-------------+-------------+----------------------+------------------------------+ | W Component | Resource | CADF | Possible | | | | Properties | Values | +=============+=============+======================+==============================+ | What | POST/PUT/ | event.type |activity/monitor/control | | | DELETE | event.outcome |success/failure/pending | | | v1/secrets | | | +-------------+-------------+----------------------+------------------------------+ | When | | event.eventTime |{event generation timestamp} | +-------------+-------------+----------------------+------------------------------+ | Who | | initiator.id |{token user id} | | | | initiator.type |service/security/account/user | | | | initiator.project_id |{scoped token project id} | +-------------+-------------+----------------------+------------------------------+ | From Where | | initiator.host |environemnt REMOTE_ADDR | | | | initiator.agent |environment HTTP_USER_AGENT | +-------------+-------------+----------------------+------------------------------+ | On What | | target.id |resource id (secret/container)| | | | target.type |data/keymgr/secret | +-------------+-------------+----------------------+------------------------------+ | Where | | observer.id |target | | | | observer.type |service/keymgr | +-------------+-------------+----------------------+------------------------------+ | To Where | | | | +-------------+-------------+----------------------+------------------------------+ CADF extension properties (mentioned below) can be used to capture domain specific data available as part of rest request. Currently there is no plan to add these properties as this may need per resource awareness in common decorator logic. - event.attachments (structured or unstructured data) - event.tags (domain specific identifiers/ classifications) Creation of audit event requires oslo pyCADF library. pyCADF library needs to be updated to reflect Barbican specific resource types. As per pyCADF contributors, either use existing types or create very few new generic types. So far, new Barbican specific resource types identified are 'data/keymgr/secret', 'data/keymgr/container', 'data/keymgr/order' and 'data/keymgr' as resource for remaining resourcs. Audit Event Delivery -------------------- Audit event decorator is going to be added to rest API which makes modifications in Barbican resources. So decorator is going to be added to POST/PUT/DELETE requests on secrets, orders, containers, consumers, transport keys. A oslo messaging based notifier is going to be used to publish CADF events to configured messaging infrastructure. We need to make this way of audit delivery configurable as developer boxes may not necessarily have the needed setup. By default, audit delivery as notification is going to disabled. In that case, the audit event data can written to log files instead. Alternatives ------------ We could rely on Barbican existing logging but that does not provide a complete and consistent picture of service audit data. Non-standard logging means that cloud provider need service specific audit tools to aggregate and analyze the logs. Security impact --------------- This improves security in the stack by providing audit capability. This will help in addressing some of compliance requirements expected from Barbican service. Notifications & Audit Impact ---------------------------- Will have additional notification capability to publish audit events. Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ There should be very minimal impact because of additional logic to publish CADF events as notifications. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) Primary assignee: arunkant Work Items ---------- * Add new blueprint and update oslo pyCADF libarary. * Add new decorator to create CADF event data. * Add new notifier with configurable option to turn it on. * Add decorators to specific rest controller resources. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= The new unit tests is going to be added to verify audit event data content. Documentation Impact ==================== May need to add documentation around CADF event usage. References ========== * CADF Working Group. http://www.dmtf.org/standards/cadf * CADF representation for OpenStack http://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP2038_1.0.0.pdf * PyCADF developer docs http://docs.openstack.org/developer/pycadf/ * CADF event model and taxonomies https://wiki.openstack.org/w/images/e/e1/Introduction_to_Cloud_Auditing_using_CADF_Event_Model_and_Taxonomy_2013-10-22.pdf * Ceilometer CADF support https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Ceilometer/blueprints/support-standard-audit-formats

using those names.

commit_message:
Add hardware-assisted virtualization as a requirement for Sahara

Without it Sahara works poorly, and so we need to warn users.

Change-Id: I478a4bbd259d1d86d8cba2252b7b408c3ff0c032
Closes-Bug: #1457861
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/84/185384/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: **Hardware-assisted virtualization** In order for Sahara to work properly, hardware-assisted virtualization must be enabled for the hypervisor used by OpenStack. Its absence leads to frequent random errors during Hadoop deployment, because in that case VMs are too 'weak' to run such a heavywight application. To ensure that Sahara will work properly, you should do two things: - While deploying OpenStack environment via Fuel UI, select hypervisor other than QEMU. - Make sure that CPUs on compute nodes support hardware-assisted virtualization. To check that, run the following command on deployed compute nodes: :: cat /proc/cpuinfo | grep --color "vmx\|svm" While most modern x86 CPUs support hardware-assisted virtualization, its support still might be absent on compute nodes if they are themselves running as virtual machines. In that case hypervisor running compute nodes must support nested virtualization and have it enabled. VirtualBox does not support nested virtualization, and as a result environments deployed by :ref:`virtualbox` will have Sahara working poorly.

commit_message:
Pre-versions are now $VERSION.0b1

To further align with the canonical form of PEP440, pre-versions
leading to $VERSION should no longer be ${VERSION}b1 but
${VERSION}.0b1.

NB: rcdelivery.sh will need a similar fix when we rewrite it to
support separate server versioning.

Change-Id: Id8c491ee19291398a26cda41f1f64de8bb4644be

commit_message:
Raise correct exception on missing attribute

Python2 required any exception raised for hasattr(). Python3 requires
specifically AttributeError.

Change-Id: I1e4ba0617e3cdf6109baf13dc503cd31ffe59df3

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixes method retrieving free SCSI controller slot on V1

The method retrieving a free SCSI controller slot gets all the
related disk resources, checking their address using the
AddressOnParent attribute.

The issue is that this WMI object attribute is not available on the
V1 virtualization namespace, for which reason this method will raise
an AttributeError in case there disks connected to the SCSI
controller.

This patch fixes the issue by properly retrieving the disk address.

Closes-Bug: #1467916

Change-Id: I7f88e37ac6d13cd8a15b17939ec8dbdca2c988e1
(cherry picked from commit 209a7fd2285fbcdafe66d1218dd3874ed51dde78)

.warn() is deprecated

On python3 .warn() is deprecated. Use .warning() instead.

Change-Id: I08135280f7955edc3e86367a06956fba7c4d2174

commit_message:
Add doc warning to engine components

These components are internal to an engine and should
not be used externally so make sure we add a doc note
that states this (or at least warns about using them
minimally).

There are still useful to document as they are used
in docs that describe how engines work and what they
do.

Change-Id: I9143f5d7114ccedddee602dabff4b48446bd99ff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/78/193778/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. warning:: External usage of internal engine functions and modules should be kept to a **minimum** as they may be altered, refactored or moved to other locations **without** notice (and without the typical deprecation cycle).

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixes method retrieving free SCSI controller slot on V1

The method retrieving a free SCSI controller slot gets all the
related disk resources, checking their address using the
AddressOnParent attribute.

The issue is that this WMI object attribute is not available on the
V1 virtualization namespace, for which reason this method will raise
an AttributeError in case there disks connected to the SCSI
controller.

This patch fixes the issue by properly retrieving the disk address.

Closes-Bug: #1467916

Change-Id: I7f88e37ac6d13cd8a15b17939ec8dbdca2c988e1

The " "chosen port is displayed in the service's log file.") eventlet_backdoor_opts = [ cfg.StrOpt('backdoor_port', help="Enable eventlet backdoor. %s" % help_for_backdoor_port) ] CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(eventlet_backdoor_opts) LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def list_opts(): """Entry point for oslo-config-generator. """ return [(None, copy.deepcopy(eventlet_backdoor_opts))] class EventletBackdoorConfigValueError(Exception): def __init__(self, port_range, help_msg, ex): msg = ('Invalid backdoor_port configuration %(range)s: %(ex)s. ' '%(help)s' % {'range': port_range, 'ex': ex, 'help': help_msg}) super(EventletBackdoorConfigValueError, self).__init__(msg) self.port_range = port_range def _dont_use_this(): print("Don't use this, just disconnect instead") def _find_objects(t): return [o for o in gc.get_objects() if isinstance(o, t)] def _print_greenthreads(): for i, gt in enumerate(_find_objects(greenlet.greenlet)): print(i, gt) traceback.print_stack(gt.gr_frame) print() def _print_nativethreads(): for threadId, stack in sys._current_frames().items(): print(threadId) traceback.print_stack(stack) print() def _parse_port_range(port_range): if ':' not in port_range: start, end = port_range, port_range else: start, end = port_range.split(':', 1) try: start, end = int(start), int(end) if end < start: raise ValueError return start, end except ValueError as ex: raise EventletBackdoorConfigValueError(port_range, ex, help_for_backdoor_port) def _listen(host, start_port, end_port, listen_func): try_port = start_port while True: try: return listen_func((host, try_port)) except socket.error as exc: if (exc.errno != errno.EADDRINUSE or try_port >= end_port): raise try_port += 1 def initialize_if_enabled(): backdoor_locals = { 'exit': _dont_use_this, # So we don't exit the entire process 'quit': _dont_use_this, # So we don't exit the entire process 'fo': _find_objects, 'pgt': _print_greenthreads, 'pnt': _print_nativethreads, } if CONF.backdoor_port is None: return None start_port, end_port = _parse_port_range(str(CONF.backdoor_port)) # NOTE(johannes): The standard sys.displayhook will print the value of # the last expression and set it to __builtin__._, which overwrites # the __builtin__._ that gettext sets. Let's switch to using pprint # since it won't interact poorly with gettext, and it's easier to # read the output too. def displayhook(val): if val is not None: pprint.pprint(val) sys.displayhook = displayhook sock = _listen('localhost', start_port, end_port, eventlet.listen) # In the case of backdoor port being zero, a port number is assigned by # listen(). In any case, pull the port number out here. port = sock.getsockname()[1] LOG.info( _LI('Eventlet backdoor listening on %(port)s for process %(pid)d'), {'port': port, 'pid': os.getpid()} ) eventlet.spawn_n(eventlet.backdoor.backdoor_server, sock, locals=backdoor_locals) return port

commit_message:
Do not update existing image on create by default

Openstack image create command updates existing image (with same name) by
default. Glance client allow create multiple images with same name, what
can lead to unwanted update of existing image when creating a new one.

Parameter --or-update was added to openstack image create to allow
update existing image, otherwise image create does not update existing
image with same name.

Change-Id: Ib521ef628da2ccb8d50a4e7a8bb1c5f81cb2b3f6
Closes-Bug: #1461817

commit_message:
Opencontrail: Create neutron::plugins::opencontrail

Create the neutron::plugins::opencontrail class that allows one to
configure neutron to work with opencontrail. The parameters have been
taken from here[1]

[1]
https://github.com/Juniper/contrail-neutron-plugin/blob/master/etc/neutron/plugins/opencontrail/ContrailPlugin.ini

Change-Id: I080c4aed23ebde320e67c98c44171b18bf2758ad

commit_message:
Switch to oslo_serialization

oslo.serialization 1.2.0 has moved its namespace from old
oslo.serialization to oslo_serialization, the old import style can
still work, but will not be supported in next release cycle.

Change-Id: If271b6d20b0b87ff0de0776dcaaba04a17193885

commit_message:
Sync 'report' from oslo-incubator

Needed to fix guru meditation report for Windows.
We landed an outdated 'report' module recently.

Add report.[generators,models,views] to
openstack-common.conf.

Oslo source: c4c7dd28 Updated from global requirements

Closes-Bug: #1286528

Change-Id: Ib33542718176241663c0e61605acbf4e941e2ca9

commit_message:
Add --prefix to override .buildconf

Add in the ability to override the prefix in .buildconf files removing
the requirement to set the prefix in a .buildconf to limit the number
of images built.

Partially Implements: blueprint refactor-base-image-layout

Change-Id: I1da1559e660adc2fe9eaf5e17ce427c89645a8b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/86/191486/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [ -n "${FORCE_PREFIX}" ] && PREFIX="${FORCE_PREFIX}"--prefix <image_prefix>PARSED_ARGS=$(getopt -q -o hr:n:t: -l help,prefix:,namespace:,release,tag:,private-registry:,from:,to:,testmode -- "$@") (--prefix) shift FORCE_PREFIX="$1" ;;

commit_message:
Removes lockfile from requirements

It doesn't look like murano in stable/kilo uses lockfile.
This patch removes it from requirements. Note that lockfile
is currently a problem because version 0.9 is incompatible
with the old API of v 0.8, so I'd prefer to get this unstable
requirement removed.

Change-Id: I2ff2e35de12418790f1c4669d4c316b08408d6b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/47/194247/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Make use of devstack external plugin

Instead of copying files manually to devstack it much
easier to use the devstack external plugin interface [1].
This makes the usage of Murano much easier for developers.

The plugin.sh script is a copy of contrib/devstack/lib/*
and contrib/devstack/extras.d/70-murano.sh. These scripts
can be removed after the CI system is switch to the new
model.

[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/plugins.html#externally-hosted-plugins

Change-Id: I9fc24d17301947f5a95c139576037efc679d4bc4
Implements: bp use-devstack-plugin

commit_message:
Add installing keytrustee-keyprovider package

We add install keytrustee-keyprovider package to support Key Trustee
KMS in CDH plugin.

Partial-implements: blueprint cdh-kms-support
Change-Id: I7cea6e9be6b9d21d12fccc08055bc71896742668
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements refs/changes/83/189183/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [ $DIB_CDH_VERSION \> "5.0" ]; thenif [ $DIB_CDH_VERSION \> "5.3" ]; then # Install KMS package install-packages \ keytrustee-keyprovider fi

commit_message:
Add 2 callbacks to processutils.execute()

Add optional on_execute and on_completion callbacks to allow callers of
procesutils.execute() to track process completion asynchronously.

This could be used to cache the pid of long running tasks associated
with an instance and then clear the cache when the process completes.
While the tasks are running should it be required the pid retrieved and
the process can be signaled.

Conflicts:
        oslo_concurrency/processutils.py

Co-Authored-By: abhishekkekane <abhishek.kekane@nttdata.com>
Change-Id: Ifc23325eddb523f6449ba06a2deb0885a8a7009d
(cherry picked from commit d8307005bfac7d680bb1975733928e52e9053b77)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.concurrency refs/changes/02/193102/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_execute_with_callback(self): on_execute_callback = mock.Mock() on_completion_callback = mock.Mock() processutils.execute("/bin/true") self.assertEqual(0, on_execute_callback.call_count) self.assertEqual(0, on_completion_callback.call_count) processutils.execute("/bin/true", on_execute=on_execute_callback, on_completion=on_completion_callback) self.assertEqual(1, on_execute_callback.call_count) self.assertEqual(1, on_completion_callback.call_count)

commit_message:
Run sudo /w -H in akanda post_test_hook

Looks like the new version of tox is more picky about this and
failing to install deps without it.

Change-Id: I69d3b2e7c7dabf39fc8dca72af53e8eed3f005d5

commit_message:
Fix manual assignment of nodes to node groups

Assigning nodes to a node group now works by updating
the 'group_id' attribute on a collection of nodes.

Change-Id: I10ba150ede24a47b75c2ff4dc5bff7c0317e7c22
Closes-bug: #1464682

commit_message:
[WIP] Basic Address Scope neutron client changes

Mainly for backup purposes, don't spend your time reviewing it.
Changes done: Enable creating, reading and deleting address scopes
via REST API. Includes required changes to REST, model.
Work InProgress: REST updation, alembic migrations, and unit tests.

Change-Id: Icf063d73b3fe8a28cd3e5c0daeeb40c3363c068b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/04/190104/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 OpenStack Foundation. # All Rights Reserved # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # from neutronclient.i18n import _ from neutronclient.neutron import v2_0 as neutronV20 def add_updatable_arguments(parser): parser.add_argument( '--subnetpool', action='append', dest='subnetpool', help=_('Address scope subnetpool list (This option can be repeated).')) def updatable_args2body(parsed_args, body, for_create=True): neutronV20.update_dict(parsed_args, body['addrscope'], ['name', 'subnetpool']) class ListAddrScope(neutronV20.ListCommand): """List address scopes that belong to a given tenant.""" resource = 'addrscope' list_columns = ['id', 'name', 'subnetpool'] pagination_support = True sorting_support = True class ShowAddrScope(neutronV20.ShowCommand): """Show information of a given address scope.""" resource = 'addrscope' class CreateAddrScope(neutronV20.CreateCommand): """Create a address scope for a given tenant.""" resource = 'addrscope' def add_known_arguments(self, parser): add_updatable_arguments(parser) parser.add_argument( '--shared', action='store_true', help=_('Set the address scope as shared.')) parser.add_argument( 'name', help=_('Name of address scopw to create.')) def args2body(self, parsed_args): body = {'addrscope': {'subnetpool': parsed_args.subnetpool}} updatable_args2body(parsed_args, body) if parsed_args.shared: body['addrscope']['shared'] = True return body class DeleteAddrScope(neutronV20.DeleteCommand): """Delete a given address scope.""" resource = 'addrscope' class UpdateAddrScope(neutronV20.UpdateCommand): """Update address scope information.""" resource = 'addrscope' def add_known_arguments(self, parser): add_updatable_arguments(parser) parser.add_argument('--name', help=_('Name of address scope to update.')) def args2body(self, parsed_args): body = {'addrscope': {}} updatable_args2body(parsed_args, body, for_create=False) return body

subject: Update milestone.sh to support new versioning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-22 10:08:42.000000000', 'files': ['milestone.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/release-tools/commit/d3ebc510175c2842ed6cde3834399e94bea70cfa', 'message': 'Update milestone.sh to support new versioning

Update milestone.sh for liberty-style development milestone releases:
- Derive version from checked-out setup.cfg
- Use common functions for titles and temp space setup
- Remove Swift-specific IS_RELEASE=1 case (as this script is only for
  milestone-driven projects)
- Remove tarball comparison step and HEADSHA warnings (since post-merge
  jobs are so slow we almost never have a good tarball to compare from)

Change-Id: I53ff60097e0a437f7bb02746e10ee70d26d305de
'}]
commit_message:
Update milestone.sh to support new versioning

Update milestone.sh for liberty-style development milestone releases:
- Derive version from checked-out setup.cfg
- Use common functions for titles and temp space setup
- Remove Swift-specific IS_RELEASE=1 case (as this script is only for
  milestone-driven projects)
- Remove tarball comparison step and HEADSHA warnings (since post-merge
  jobs are so slow we almost never have a good tarball to compare from)

Change-Id: I53ff60097e0a437f7bb02746e10ee70d26d305de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/68/194068/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TOOLSDIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )" source $TOOLSDIR/functions setup_temp_space milestone-$PROJECTgit review -s title "Resolving $MILESTONE to version" RELVERSION=`grep "version = " setup.cfg | awk -F" " '{ print $3 }'` if [[ "$RELVERSION" == "" ]]; then echo "Could not determine pre-version from setup.cfg" exit 1 fi VERSION="${RELVERSION}b${MILESTONE: -1}" echo "${PROJECT^} $MILESTONE is $VERSION (final being $RELVERSION)"TAGMSG="${PROJECT^} $MILESTONE milestone ($VERSION)" $TOOLSDIR/upload_release.py $LPROJECT $RELVERSION \ --milestone=$MILESTONE --nop
deleted_lines: TOOLSDIR="$( cd "$( dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}" )" && pwd )" function title { echo echo "$(tput bold)$(tput setaf 1)[ $1 ]$(tput sgr0)" } if [[ "$PROJECT" == "swift" ]]; then echo "Swift mode: skipping fixreleasing (bugs should be set at RC time)" SKIPBUGS=1 IS_RELEASE=1 fi title "Resolving $MILESTONE to version" if [[ "$IS_RELEASE" == "1" ]]; then VERSION=$MILESTONE RELVERSION=$MILESTONE else VERSION=`$TOOLSDIR/ms2version.py $LPROJECT $MILESTONE` RELVERSION=${VERSION:0:8} fi echo "$MILESTONE is $VERSION (final being $RELVERSION)"MYTMPDIR=`mktemp -d` cd $MYTMPDIRLANG=C git review -sHEADSHA=`git log -1 HEAD --format='%H'`if [[ "$IS_RELEASE" == "1" ]]; then TAGMSG="${PROJECT^} $VERSION release" else TAGMSG="${PROJECT^} $MILESTONE milestone ($VERSION)" fi echo "Tag message is '$TAGMSG'" if [[ "$TARGETSHA" != "$HEADSHA" ]]; then echo "Warning: target SHA does not correspond to HEAD" fititle "Cleaning up" cd ../.. rm -rf $MYTMPDIR title "Checking tarball is similar to last master.tar.gz" if [[ "$TARGETSHA" != "$HEADSHA" ]]; then echo "It will probably be a bit different since target is not HEAD." fi $TOOLSDIR/similar_tarballs.sh $PROJECT master $VERSION read -sn 1 -p "Press any key to continue..." if [[ "$IS_RELEASE" == "1" ]]; then $TOOLSDIR/upload_release.py $LPROJECT $RELVERSION \ --deliverable=$PROJECT else $TOOLSDIR/upload_release.py $LPROJECT $RELVERSION \ fi --milestone=$MILESTONE --nop

subject: Support string flavor IDs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-19 11:18:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/222c06a5c25d4c4da20491fc24aea3813ad43326', 'message': "Support string flavor IDs

This allows operating on Nova flavors with non-integer ids
by adding a new str_id field to the view that always contains the
unicode flavor id.  The current id field will now contain a value
only when the flavor's id can be cast to int, otherwise it will be
None.  Validation of flavor id when querying a flavor or creating an
instance has been updated to include non-empty strings in addition to
integers.

This will require a patch to python-troveclient to properly fallback
to str_id in absence of the integer id:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123301/

(cherry picked from commit 21fee8c3c554ba158c2bbe977131522a204c22cc)

commit_message:
Support string flavor IDs

This allows operating on Nova flavors with non-integer ids
by adding a new str_id field to the view that always contains the
unicode flavor id.  The current id field will now contain a value
only when the flavor's id can be cast to int, otherwise it will be
None.  Validation of flavor id when querying a flavor or creating an
instance has been updated to include non-empty strings in addition to
integers.

This will require a patch to python-troveclient to properly fallback
to str_id in absence of the integer id:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/123301/

(cherry picked from commit 21fee8c3c554ba158c2bbe977131522a204c22cc)

Change-Id: Ie9cfefc6127bc76783cdf9668636342d7590b308
Closes-bug: #1333852

commit_message:
Implement update for Manila::Share

Implement handle_update for Manila::Share
resource.

Change-Id: I46e8d74ba72478c3a42458989d6eb8289aaad59f
Implements: partial blueprint add-manila-resources
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/45/171845/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def handle_update(self, json_snippet, tmpl_diff, prop_diff): if self.NAME in prop_diff or self.DESCRIPTION in prop_diff: update_name = (prop_diff.get(self.NAME) or self.properties.get(self.NAME)) update_description = (prop_diff.get(self.DESCRIPTION) or self.properties.get(self.DESCRIPTION)) kwargs = { "display_name": update_name, "display_description": update_description } self.client().shares.update(self._resource_id_obj(), **kwargs) if self.METADATA in prop_diff: metadata = prop_diff.get(self.METADATA) self.client().shares.update_all_metadata( self._resource_id_obj(), metadata) if self.ACCESS_RULES in prop_diff: # compare updated and current rules, deny rules that absent in # current template and apply the new rules in updated template updated_access_rules = sorted( prop_diff.get(self.ACCESS_RULES), key=lambda k: k[self.ACCESS_TO], reverse=True) current_access_rules = sorted( self.client().shares.access_list(self._resource_id_obj()), key=lambda k: k[self.ACCESS_TO], reverse=True) total_len = len(updated_access_rules) + len(current_access_rules) minus_infinity = {self.ACCESS_TO: "", self.ACCESS_TYPE: "", self.ACCESS_LEVEL: ""} updated_access_rules.append(minus_infinity) current_access_rules.append(minus_infinity) upd_iter = iter(updated_access_rules) cur_iter = iter(current_access_rules) upd_rule = next(upd_iter) cur_rule = next(cur_iter) # merge two lists of rules # if the new rule is in updated rule list then apply the rule # if the current rule is not present in updated rule list deny it for i in xrange(total_len): rule_equal = ( upd_rule[self.ACCESS_TO] == cur_rule[self.ACCESS_TO] and upd_rule[self.ACCESS_TYPE] == cur_rule[self.ACCESS_TYPE] and upd_rule[self.ACCESS_LEVEL] == cur_rule[self.ACCESS_LEVEL]) if rule_equal: cur_rule = next(cur_iter) upd_rule = next(upd_iter) elif upd_rule[self.ACCESS_TO] > cur_rule[self.ACCESS_TO]: self.client().shares.allow( share=self._resource_id_obj(), access_type=upd_rule[self.ACCESS_TYPE], access=upd_rule[self.ACCESS_TO], access_level=upd_rule[self.ACCESS_LEVEL] ) upd_rule = next(upd_iter) else: self.client().shares.deny(share=self._resource_id_obj(), id=cur_rule["id"]) cur_rule = next(cur_iter)

commit_message:
Check both master and env repos for packages

In tests with Ubuntu for environment operation
system some packages on master node (CentOS)
could be updated, so tests must search packages
in both repositories types.

Also copy master node packages to 'deb' section,
because they are needed to determine package
installation target.

Change-Id: I96edc27278229d525da20c9b1237ebded34acaf7
Implements: blueprint mos-patching-tests

commit_message:
[VB guide] Edits

1. Removes 'IMG' from the instructions
2. Changes vboxnet1 IP address to 172.16.0.254
3. Replaces screens
4. Changes adapter type to Intel PRO/1000 MT Desktop
5. Adds Ubuntu 14.04

Closes-bug: 1467799
Change-Id: I7bf448038b7cfffae7392b018aa903a5c8193fbb

commit_message:
libvirt: set admin root password

Enhance libvirt to set admin root password for
Qemu/KVM users

Change-Id: I01e472fd052538e369d44737f29e39505fc5de09
Implements: blueprint libvirt-set-admin-password
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/09/187509/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================== Libvirt Set Admin Root Password =============================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/libvirt-set-admin-password Nova provides API to let users set an administrator password on a virtual machine already active. The purpose of this spec is to take advantage of the libvirt API set-user-password provided with version 1.2.16 to implement that feature for Qemu/KVM users. Problem description =================== Nova provides API to let users set an administrator password but Qemu/KVM users cannot take advantage of it. Use Cases ---------- Operator want the ability to reset administrator password of an instance already active by using the command "nova root-password <instance>" Project Priority ----------------- None. Proposed change =============== Most of the change will be done on the libvirt driver itself. For unix-like virtual machines user updated will be "root" and for Windows virtual machines user updated will be "Administrator". To handle the case where administrator user on Windows is not "Administrator" a new property "os_admin_user" will be introduced in image property to let users define who is the administrator. Alternatives ------------ An already implemented feature "inject_password" is able to achieve this work when the virtual machine is booting. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- The end user will have to install a qemu gest agent to take part of this feature 'qemu-guest-agent'. The end user will need to know about the 'os_admin_user' glance property and the list of permissible values. This is primarily a documentation task. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: sahid-ferdjaoui Work Items ---------- * Implement method set_admin_password * Extend the method set_admin_password to read in image property for specific admin user Dependencies ============ Libvirt 1.2.16 Testing ======= The unit tests will cover the new code. The nova API is already covered by tests Documentation Impact ==================== The new glance image property will need to be documented. References ========== * http://wiki.qemu.org/Features/QAPI/GuestAgent

Wait for tasks and check their status (patching)

In patching tests wait until task is finished and
check its status is ready.

Closes-bug: #1466805

added_lines: 'tasks_timeout': { 'required': False, 'data_type': int }, slaves = [] if not slaves else slaves tasks_timeout = apply_step['tasks_timeout'] if 'tasks_timeout' in \ apply_step.keys() else 60 * 30 command = [ 'RUN_TASKS', nodes_ids, apply_step['tasks'], tasks_timeout ] elif 'RUN_TASKS' in command: nodes_ids = command[1], tasks = command[2] timeout = command[3] nodes = [node for node in environment.fuel_web.client.list_nodes() if node['id'] in nodes_ids] assert_true(len(nodes_ids) == len(nodes), 'Get nodes with ids: {0} for deployment task, but' 'found {1}!'.format(nodes_ids, [n['id'] for n in nodes])) assert_true(len(set([node['cluster'] for node in nodes])) == 1, 'Slaves for patching actions belong to different ' 'environments, can\'t run deployment tasks!') cluster_id = nodes[0]['cluster'] environment.fuel_web.wait_deployment_tasks(cluster_id, nodes_ids, tasks, timeout) continue

commit_message:
Save custom repository config to separate file

On Ubuntu it's necessary to create separate files
for custom repositories configurations, because
file '/etc/apt/sources.list' is truncated by
'upload_core_repos' deployment task.

Change-Id: I2e1b6294e3fb8704961794fc0bdf9a755a59e837
Closes-bug: #1466756

commit_message:
Check both master and env repos for packages

In tests with Ubuntu for environment operation
system some packages on master node (CentOS)
could be updated, so tests must search packages
in both repositories types.

Also copy master node packages to 'deb' section,
because they are needed to determine package
installation target.

Change-Id: I96edc27278229d525da20c9b1237ebded34acaf7
Implements: blueprint mos-patching-tests

commit_message:
Implement create-delete-check for Manila::Share

Implement handle_create, handle_delete and
handle_check for Manila::Share - shared mountable filesystem.

Change-Id: I9d3351ba0151fdaedb62f71759813a23f57b0623
Implements: partial blueprint add-manila-resources
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/06/171806/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_serialization import jsonutils import six from heat.common.i18n import _ from heat.engine import attributes from heat.engine import clients from heat.engine import constraints from heat.engine import properties from heat.engine import resource from heat.engine import support class ManilaShare(resource.Resource): """ A resource that creates shared mountable file system. The resource creates a manila share - shared mountable filesystem that can be attached to several VMs. Share is a unit of storage with specific size that supports pre-defined share protocol and advanced security model (access lists, shared networks and security groups). All shares exist on backend integrated with share through drivers. """ support_status = support.SupportStatus(version='2015.1') _ACCESS_RULE_PROPERTIES = ( ACCESS_TO, ACCESS_TYPE, ACCESS_LEVEL) = ( "access_to", "access_type", "access_level") _SHARE_STATUSES = ( STATUS_CREATING, STATUS_DELETING, STATUS_ERROR, STATUS_ERROR_DELETING, STATUS_AVAILABLE ) = ( "creating", "deleting", "error", "error_deleting", "available" ) PROPERTIES = ( SHARE_PROTOCOL, SIZE, SHARE_SNAPSHOT, NAME, METADATA, SHARE_NETWORK, DESCRIPTION, SHARE_TYPE, IS_PUBLIC, ACCESS_RULES ) = ( "share_protocol", "size", "snapshot", "name", "metadata", "share_network", "description", "share_type", "is_public", "access_rules" ) properties_schema = { SHARE_PROTOCOL: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _("Share protocol supported by shared filesystem."), required=True, constraints=[constraints.AllowedValues( ["NFS", "CIFS", "GlusterFS", "HDFS"])] ), SIZE: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.INTEGER, _("Share storage size in Gb."), required=True ), SHARE_SNAPSHOT: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _("ID of shared file system snapshot that will be restored and " "created as a new share."), constraints=[constraints.CustomConstraint("manila.share_snapshot")] ), NAME: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _("Share name."), update_allowed=True ), METADATA: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.MAP, _("Metadata key-values defined for share."), update_allowed=True ), SHARE_NETWORK: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _("Name of shared network defined for shared filesystem."), constraints=[constraints.CustomConstraint("manila.share_network")] ), DESCRIPTION: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _("Share description."), update_allowed=True ), SHARE_TYPE: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _("Type of shared filesystem. Types defines some share filesystem " "profiles that will be used for share creation."), constraints=[constraints.CustomConstraint("manila.share_type")] ), IS_PUBLIC: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.BOOLEAN, _("Defines if shared filesystem is public or private."), default=False ), ACCESS_RULES: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.LIST, _("A list of access rules that define access from IP to Share."), schema=properties.Schema( properties.Schema.MAP, schema={ ACCESS_TO: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _("IP or other address information about guest that " "allowed to access to Share."), required=True ), ACCESS_TYPE: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _("Type of access that should be provided to guest."), constraints=[constraints.AllowedValues( ["ip", "domain"])], required=True ), ACCESS_LEVEL: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _("Level of access that need to be provided for " "guest."), constraints=[constraints.AllowedValues(["ro", "rw"])], required=True ) } ), update_allowed=True, default=[] ) } ATTRIBUTES = ( AVAILABILITY_ZONE_ATTR, HOST_ATTR, EXPORT_LOCATIONS_ATTR, SHARE_SERVER_ID_ATTR, CREATED_AT_ATTR, SHARE_STATUS_ATTR ) = ( "availability_zone", "host", "export_locations", "share_server_id", "created_at", "status" ) attributes_schema = { AVAILABILITY_ZONE_ATTR: attributes.Schema( _("The availability zone of shared filesystem.") ), HOST_ATTR: attributes.Schema( _("Share host.") ), EXPORT_LOCATIONS_ATTR: attributes.Schema( _("Export locations of Share.") ), SHARE_SERVER_ID_ATTR: attributes.Schema( _("ID of shared back-end storage used by share.") ), CREATED_AT_ATTR: attributes.Schema( _("Datetime when a share was created.") ), SHARE_STATUS_ATTR: attributes.Schema( _("Current share status.") ) } default_client_name = "manila" class IDWrapper(object): """Simple wrapper required for Manila API. Manila API in some cases required the object with 'id' attribute to be passed instead of string value. So the class wraps the string value with appropriate object for interaction with Manila API. """ def __init__(self, res_id): self.id = res_id def _resource_id_obj(self): return self.IDWrapper(self.resource_id) def _request_share(self): return self.client().shares.get(self.resource_id) def _resolve_attribute(self, name): share = self._request_share() if name == self.EXPORT_LOCATIONS_ATTR: return six.text_type(jsonutils.dumps(share.export_locations)) return six.text_type(getattr(share, name)) def handle_create(self): share = self.client().shares.create( share_proto=self.properties.get(self.SHARE_PROTOCOL), size=self.properties.get(self.SIZE), snapshot_id=self.properties.get(self.SHARE_SNAPSHOT), name=self.properties.get(self.NAME), description=self.properties.get(self.DESCRIPTION), metadata=self.properties.get(self.METADATA), share_network=self.IDWrapper( self.properties.get(self.SHARE_NETWORK)), share_type=self.properties.get(self.SHARE_TYPE), is_public=self.properties.get(self.IS_PUBLIC)) access_rules = self.properties.get(self.ACCESS_RULES) if access_rules: for rule in access_rules: self.client().shares.allow( share=share, access_type=rule[self.ACCESS_TYPE], access=rule[self.ACCESS_TO], access_level=rule[self.ACCESS_LEVEL]) self.resource_id_set(share.id) def check_create_complete(self, *args): share = self._request_share() status = share.status if status == self.STATUS_CREATING: return False elif status == self.STATUS_AVAILABLE: return True elif status == self.STATUS_ERROR: reason = _("Error during creation of share '{0}'").format( share.id) raise resource.ResourceInError(status_reason=reason, resource_status=status) else: reason = _("Unknown status during creation of share '{0}'").format( share.id) raise resource.ResourceUnknownStatus(status_reason=reason, resource_status=status) def handle_delete(self): if not self.resource_id: return try: self.client().shares.delete(self._resource_id_obj()) except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found(ex) def check_delete_complete(self, *args): if not self.resource_id: return True try: share = self._request_share() except Exception as ex: self.client_plugin().ignore_not_found(ex) return True else: if share.status == self.STATUS_DELETING: return False elif share.status in (self.STATUS_ERROR, self.STATUS_ERROR_DELETING): raise resource.ResourceInError( status_reason=_( "Error during deleting share '{0}'. Cannot proceed " "deletion.").format(self.resource_id), resource_status=share.status) else: reason = _("Unknown status during creation of share " "'{0}'").format(self.resource_id) raise resource.ResourceUnknownStatus( status_reason=reason, resource_status=share.status) def handle_check(self): share = self._request_share() expected_statuses = [self.STATUS_AVAILABLE] checks = [{"attr": "status", "expected": expected_statuses, "current": share.status}] self._verify_check_conditions(checks) def resource_mapping(): return {"OS::Manila::Share": ManilaShare} def available_resource_mapping(): if not clients.has_client("manila"): return {} return resource_mapping()
